\">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 12 Aug 2020 10:00:00 +0000","feedId":924,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/social-media-marketing-1.jpg#keepProtocol","linkMd5":"f373e510d75d27250dedb78eda59f510","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn31@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-27-593_db6d230f3ba2f31f.webp","metaImg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/social-media-marketing-1.jpg#keepProtocol","author":"Kayla Carmicheal","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-08-11%20at%2010.25.49%20AM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-08-11%20at%2010.25.49%20AM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn47@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-39-241_024b16a5c8dbca3c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Buffer-on-Instagram-bio-example.png?width=1500&name=Buffer-on-Instagram-bio-example.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn60@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-40-355_c759d444446d1a82.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/metter%20media%20branding.png?width=1500&name=metter%20media%20branding.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn83@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-35-323_7259e27fb0fb7cd6.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/polling%20screenshot-1.png?width=359&name=polling%20screenshot-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn32@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-31-240_6dadeb86bb6f25fb.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/linkedin%20diversifying%20content%20example.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn20@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-37-321_8caeb84084caae37.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/totinos%20promotion.png?width=1500&name=totinos%20promotion.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn20@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-33-816_fa6572d5255d4eaa.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdata-backed-social-media-marketing-tips&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn35@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-35-494_810569e6ddd4cb3a.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:26","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:26","title":"The Ultimate Online Editing and Proofreading Checklist for Writers","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ultimate-editing-checklist","description":"<p>The writing process is a chance to let creativity fly and tell a story with your own words.</p>  \n<p>Another, less glamorous part of the writing process is editing.</p> \n<p>As you may know, proofreading is essential for any blog or ebook. It makes your work look professional, and without editing, it's unclear to know how many mistakes or readability problems being published.</p> \n<p>Remembering every single little grammar and editing rule is nonsense. While many become instincts over time, humans are known to make mistakes. That's why we've created a checklist for you to use while editing so you have a point of reference while proofreading.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>This list isn't just about grammar rules; it also includes tips from topic selection, SEO, to promotion. Essentially, it can take you from beginning to the end of what you write.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Copy%20of%20Featured%20Snippet%20Template%20-%20Bullets-1.png?width=1080&amp;name=Copy%20of%20Featured%20Snippet%20Template%20-%20Bullets-1.png\" alt=\"editing and proofreading checklist graphic\" width=\"1080\" style=\"width: 1080px;\">Read on for our complete editing and proofreading checklist — made with the content creator in mind.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">The Content Creator's Editing Checklist</h2> \n<p>In this checklist, we will go over nine sections, listed below.</p> \n<h3>Topics</h3> \n<p>We'll start at the beginning with topics. Knowing which topic to write about can come from various places, but these tips will double check that what you're writing about will resonate with your readers and have the chance to rock it with SEO.</p> \n<div>\n Does this topic align with our content strategy? Will our readers/\n <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/buyer-persona-definition-under-100-sr\">buyer personas </a>care about it?\n</div> \n<div>\n &nbsp;\n</div> \n<div>\n Have we covered this topic comprehensively in the past? Will it add anything new and interesting amongst all the content clutter on the web? If both answers are yes, consider \n <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/guide-to-updating-republishing-blogging-content-ht\">updating and republishing</a> the original draft.\n</div> \n<div>\n &nbsp;\n</div> \n<div>\n Can the angle be tweaked to be even \n <em>more</em> interesting?\n</div> \n<div> \n <p> Does this topic have SEO have high potential?</p> \n <p> Is this topic relevant to the industry/timely?</p> \n <h3>Structure &amp; Format</h3> \n <p>How do you structure your pieces? This section makes sure your content is formatted in the best way for readability. It also provides some room for checking consistency.</p> \n <div>\n  Is this the right format for the content? Does this topic work better as a longer form ebook? Or in a shorter form, like a listicle?\n </div> \n <div>\n  &nbsp;\n </div> \n <div>\n  Is the flow of the content logical? Are the chapters/headers/ideas organized in an order that makes sense and naturally guides readers through the content?\n </div> \n <div>\n  &nbsp;\n </div> \n <div>\n  Are paragraphs 2-3 sections long for readability?\n </div> \n <div> \n  <div>\n   &nbsp;\n  </div> \n  <div> \n   <span>Are your headers formatted consistently -- not just within this piece of content? Are different header styles (H2 vs. H3 vs. H4) being used to properly denote content hierarchy?</span>\n  </div> \n  <div>\n   &nbsp;\n  </div> \n  <div> \n   <div>\n    Is the content comprehensive?\n    <span>Are all major points associated with the topic covered in the post?</span>\n   </div> \n   <div>\n    &nbsp;\n   </div> \n   <div> \n    <div> Can you incorporate numbered lists and/or bullets to make it easier for readers to skim, scan, and identify important takeaways?\n    </div> \n    <div> \n     <div>\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n     <div> \n      <div> Are supporting images and visuals included where appropriate?\n      </div> \n      <div>\n       &nbsp;\n      </div> \n      <div> Are these visuals and images \n       <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-post-image-selection-ht-list\">high quality</a> and interesting? Have they been resized and compressed so keep page load time short? \n       <h3><span style=\"font-size: 1em;\">Copy</span></h3> \n       <p><span style=\"font-size: 1em;\">We can't have an editing checklist without a section to double-check your copy. These are little things to make sure the narrative of your writing is succinct and engaging, as well as minor grammar edits.</span></p> \n       <div>\n        Is the content well-written? Is the writing interesting, entertaining, and easy to read?\n       </div> \n       <div> \n        <div>\n         &nbsp;\n        </div> \n        <div> \n         <div>\n          Does the content tell a story?\n         </div> \n         <div>\n          &nbsp;\n         </div> \n         <div> \n          <div>\n           Do the transitions make sense and flow well?\n          </div> \n          <div>\n           &nbsp;\n          </div> \n          <div>\n           Is the grammar correct? \n           <div>\n            <br>\n            <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-write-introduction-quick-tip-ht\">Does the introduction capture the reader's attention</a>? Is it interesting enough to get the reader to keep reading?\n           </div> \n           <div>\n            &nbsp;\n           </div> \n           <div>\n            Does the intro tee up the rest of the content well and explain the value the reader will get out of reading it? \n            <div>\n             &nbsp;\n            </div> \n            <div> \n             <div>\n              <span>Are the headers keyword-optimized, </span>\n              <span>compelling, and clear?</span>\n             </div> \n            </div> \n            <div>\n             <br>Does the tone of the writing align with the content being presented?\n            </div> \n            <div>\n             &nbsp;\n            </div> \n            <div>\n             <span>Does the content's voice coincide with the overall voice of our content and company?</span>\n            </div> \n            <div> \n             <div>\n              &nbsp;\n             </div> \n             <div>\n              Yet, are we still allowing the writer's individual writing personality to shine through? \n              <div> \n               <h3>Attribution</h3> \n               <p>Any good editor makes sure he/she is giving credit where credit is due. Here's what to think about.</p> \n               <div>\n                Are statistics, data, quotes, ideas, etc. \n                <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33098/How-Not-to-Steal-People-s-Content-on-the-Web.aspx\">properly attributed</a> to the original source with a link back?\n               </div> \n               <div>\n                &nbsp;\n               </div> \n               <div> \n                <div>\n                 Is the data interpreted correctly (i.e. not lost in translation) from the original source?\n                </div> \n                <div>\n                 &nbsp;\n                </div> \n                <div> \n                 <div>\n                  In any quotations, do we have the right spelling of the name and job title/company of the person quoted?\n                 </div> \n                 <div> \n                  <div>\n                   &nbsp;\n                  </div> \n                  <div>\n                   Are we actually \n                   <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33098/How-Not-to-Steal-People-s-Content-on-the-Web.aspx\">allowed to use these photos/images</a>?\n                   <em> (<a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/internet-copyright-law-failure\">Here's a cautionary tale about internet copyright law</a>.)</em> \n                   <h3>Title</h3> \n                   <p>Titles are the first exposure most of your readers get to your piece. How are you going to use that to your advantage? Go over some tips for the effectiveness of your title.</p> \n                   <div>\n                    Is the title compelling and interesting enough to get people to click through and read on?\n                   </div> \n                   <div>\n                    &nbsp;\n                   </div> \n                   <div> \n                    <div>\n                     Does the title accurately reflect the content within? Avoid being overly sensational or bombastic.\n                    </div> \n                    <div>\n                     &nbsp;\n                    </div> \n                    <div>\n                     Is the title brief and concise? \n                     <em>(Tip: Keep in mind longer titles will get cut off in search engine results.)</em>\n                    </div> \n                    <div> \n                     <div>\n                      <br>Is the title keyword-conscious without being keyword-heavy and sacrificing user experience and clickthroughs (\n                      <span>see also the section about search engine optimization)</span>?\n                     </div> \n                    </div> \n                    <div> \n                     <h3>Style Guide Alignment</h3> \n                     <p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/33575/Introducing-the-Internet-Marketing-Written-Style-Guide.aspx\">Written style guides </a>serve as the commonly acknowledged authority when questions of grammar, punctuation, and style come up in writing. A style guide answers questions like whether you use title case for article titles and headers; whether you capitalize the word <em>internet</em>; or whether you use the Oxford comma.</p> \n                     <p>You can either adopt an already-established style guide, like the AP Stylebook, or create an in-house version that enables you to borrow from different schools of thought and address any nuances specific to your industry or company. The important thing is to be consistent across all content you publish. Here's the main question you should ask yourself ...</p> \n                     <div>\n                      Does anything contradict our style guide? \n                      <em>(Tip: If you don't have a style guide, you can <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/the-internet-marketing-written-style-guide\">download HubSpot's and customize it as you see fit</a>.)</em> \n                      <h3>SEO</h3> \n                      <p>One of the most important parts of a post, SEO helps others and search engines find your piece. Are you doing all you can to boost that? Check your work below.</p> \n                      <div>\n                       Have you done your \n                       <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-do-keyword-research-ht\">keyword research</a> to identify relevant keywords with which to optimize your content?\n                      </div> \n                      <div> \n                       <div>\n                        &nbsp;\n                       </div> \n                       <div>\n                        Did you optimize your content using \n                        <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-seo-modern-marketer-optimize-your-posts-ht\">on-page SEO best practices?</a>\n                       </div> \n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       &nbsp;\n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       <span>If it's a blog post or web/landing page, is there a catchy, concise, and clear meta description to encourage clickthroughs in search engine results pages (SERPs)?</span>\n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       &nbsp;\n                      </div> \n                      <div> \n                       <div>\n                        <span>Are there <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/34005/How-to-Pick-the-Perfect-CTA-for-Every-Blog-Post.aspx\">relevant calls-to-action</a> (CTAs) included where appropriate to encourage conversion into subscribers, leads, etc.?<em>(Tip: Try the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/keyword-based-blog-conversion-optimization\">keyword-based conversion optimization method</a>!)</em></span>\n                       </div> \n                      </div> \n                      <h3>Finishing Touches</h3> \n                      <p>You're almost there. To make sure your post is excellent rather than mediocre, use this section to do a final run-through.</p> \n                      <div>\n                       Are there internal links to other resources, landing pages, or blog articles that might be helpful to the reader (or improve your SEO)?\n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       &nbsp;\n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       Were those links tested to confirm they work and send readers to the right place?\n                      </div> \n                      <div>\n                       &nbsp;\n                      </div> \n                      <div> \n                       <div>\n                        Is the content spell-checked?\n                       </div> \n                       <div>\n                        &nbsp;\n                       </div> \n                       <div> \n                        <div>\n                         Are any company names referenced spelled and styled correctly?\n                        </div> \n                        <div>\n                         &nbsp;\n                        </div> \n                        <div> \n                         <div>\n                          Does the content contain any sensitive or controversial information that we need to get anyone's approval on before publishing (e.g. legal or PR department)?\n                         </div> \n                         <div>\n                          &nbsp;\n                         </div> \n                         <div> \n                          <div>\n                           Have any stats cited or quotes used been fact checked?\n                          </div> \n                          <div> \n                           <div>\n                            &nbsp;\n                           </div> \n                           <div> \n                            <div>\n                             If it's a blog post, is it tagged with the appropriate topic tags?\n                            </div> \n                            <div>\n                             &nbsp;\n                            </div> \n                            <div> \n                             <div>\n                              Was the publish date/time double-checked so we're not accidentally scheduling for 8 p.m. instead of 8 a.m.?\n                              <em> (It happens. We've done it.)</em>\n                             </div> \n                             <div>\n                              &nbsp;\n                             </div> \n                             <div> \n                              <div>\n                               Are there opportunities to make the content more social (e.g. creating \n                               <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-create-embed-codes-generator-infographic-content-ht\">embed codes</a> and adding \n                               <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29544/The-Ultimate-Cheat-Sheet-for-Creating-Social-Media-Buttons.aspx\">Pinterest 'Pin it' buttons</a> to proprietary images/infographics/visuals/charts, adding \n                               <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29544/The-Ultimate-Cheat-Sheet-for-Creating-Social-Media-Buttons.aspx\">tweet links</a>, \n                               <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29544/The-Ultimate-Cheat-Sheet-for-Creating-Social-Media-Buttons.aspx\">social sharing buttons</a>, etc.)?\n                              </div> \n                              <div>\n                               &nbsp;\n                              </div> \n                              <div> \n                               <div>\n                                Did we include examples (real or hypothetical) to illustrate our points?\n                               </div> \n                               <div>\n                                &nbsp;\n                               </div> \n                               <div> \n                                <div>\n                                 Did we use data, statistics, and quotations to back up our points?\n                                </div> \n                                <div>\n                                 &nbsp;\n                                </div> \n                                <div>\n                                 Are there other supporting elements that could enhance the content?\n                                </div> \n                               </div> \n                              </div> \n                              <div> \n                               <h3>Content Promotion</h3> \n                               <p>Now that your piece is complete, you've gotta promote it. This section gives you different ideas of how to get your writing out there.</p> \n                               <div>\n                                 Have you promoted it on relevant social media channels? \n                                <div>\n                                 &nbsp;\n                                </div> \n                                <div> \n                                 <div>\n                                  <span>Have you emailed it to subscribers, leads, and other relevant contacts?</span>\n                                 </div> \n                                 <div>\n                                  &nbsp;\n                                 </div> \n                                 <div> \n                                  <div>\n                                    Can you put some paid promotion behind it using paid platforms or via advertising options available by social media sites like Facebook and Twitter?\n                                  </div> \n                                  <div>\n                                   &nbsp;\n                                  </div> \n                                  <div> \n                                   <div>\n                                    <span>Can you syndicate it to other publishing platforms like </span>\n                                    <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/linkedin-publishing-all-members-nj\">LinkedIn Pulse</a>\n                                    <span> or Medium to expose it to other audiences?</span>\n                                   </div> \n                                   <div>\n                                    &nbsp;\n                                   </div> \n                                   <div>\n                                    <span>Writing is hard and editing isn't that easy, either. Keeping this checklist saved or bookmarked is a resource to turn back to when you get stuck or need an extra check over your work.</span>\n                                   </div> \n                                   <div>\n                                    <span></span>\n                                   </div> \n                                   <div>\n                                    <span></span>\n                                   </div> \n                                  </div> \n                                 </div> \n                                </div> \n                               </div> \n                              </div> \n                             </div> \n                            </div> \n                           </div> \n                          </div> \n                         </div> \n                        </div> \n                       </div> \n                      </div> \n                     </div> \n                    </div> \n                   </div> \n                  </div> \n                 </div> \n                </div> \n               </div> \n              </div> \n             </div> \n            </div> \n           </div> \n          </div> \n         </div> \n        </div> \n       </div> \n      </div> \n     </div> \n    </div> \n   </div> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fultimate-editing-checklist&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 12 Aug 2020 12:06:00 +0000","feedId":924,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/editing-checklist%20copy.jpg#keepProtocol","linkMd5":"aa0ce8e51d985333702b2ce12af71014","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn56@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-27-476_2b3259e479110bb8.webp","metaImg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/editing-checklist%20copy.jpg#keepProtocol","destWidth":830,"destHeight":398,"author":"Kayla Carmicheal","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Copy%20of%20Featured%20Snippet%20Template%20-%20Bullets-1.png?width=1080&name=Copy%20of%20Featured%20Snippet%20Template%20-%20Bullets-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn44@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-35-225_353de7eecf4e477b.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fultimate-editing-checklist&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn99@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-30-862_87bbbe28d8635369.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:24","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:24","title":"The Move to Ecommerce: How Retailers Can Adapt During a Crisis","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/retailers-adapt-crisis","description":"<p>Ecommerce is an undeniably powerful opportunity for retail stores to increase sales and reach new customers. And, in 2020 and beyond, it will continue to become an increasingly popular shopping choice for many consumers.&nbsp;</p>  \n<p>In fact, Statista predicts that ecommerce revenue will <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ecommerce\">surpass $638 billion in the U.S.</a> by 2022.</p> \n<p>And, in 2020, amidst the global crisis, ecommerce is fast becoming the go-to model for keeping retail businesses afloat.</p> \n<p>Brands that have adopted ecommerce are seeing success, particularly since most shoppers are staying at home.</p> \n<p>But, for companies considering how to shift into ecommerce, such a drastic shift can feel like a challenge.</p> \n<p>To ease the burden on retailers, we share eight steps you should follow when implementing an ecommerce <a href=\"https://venngage.com/blog/project-management-plan/\">project management plan</a>.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>1. Pick-up and Delivery Services</h3> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0px; max-width: 540px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto; max-height: 1440px;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\" background:#FFF; border:0; border-radius:3px; box-shadow:0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width:540px; min-width:326px; padding:0; width:99.375%; width:-webkit-calc(100% - 2px); width:calc(100% - 2px);\">\n   <div style=\"padding:16px;\"> \n    <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B90G8gihVaT/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" background:#FFFFFF; line-height:0; padding:0 0; text-align:center; text-decoration:none; width:100%;\"> \n     <div style=\" display: flex; flex-direction: row; align-items: center;\"> \n      <div style=\"background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 50%; flex-grow: 0; height: 40px; margin-right: 14px; width: 40px;\">\n       &nbsp;\n      </div> \n      <div style=\"display: flex; flex-direction: column; flex-grow: 1; justify-content: center;\"> \n       <div style=\" background-color: #F4F4F4; height: 14px; width: 60px;\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div>\n      </div>\n     </div>\n     <div style=\"padding: 19% 0;\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n     <div style=\"display:block; height:50px; margin:0 auto 12px; width:50px;\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div>\n     <div style=\"padding-top: 8px;\"> \n      <div style=\" color:#3897f0; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:550; line-height:18px;\">\n        View this post on Instagram\n      </div>\n     </div>\n     <div style=\"padding: 12.5% 0;\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n     <div style=\"display: flex; flex-direction: row; margin-bottom: 14px; align-items: center;\">\n      <div> \n       <div style=\"background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 50%; height: 12.5px; width: 12.5px; transform: translateX(0px) translateY(7px);\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div> \n       <div style=\"background-color: #F4F4F4; height: 12.5px; transform: rotate(-45deg) translateX(3px) translateY(1px); width: 12.5px; flex-grow: 0; margin-right: 14px; margin-left: 2px;\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div> \n       <div style=\"background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 50%; height: 12.5px; width: 12.5px; transform: translateX(9px) translateY(-18px);\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div style=\"margin-left: 8px;\"> \n       <div style=\" background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 50%; flex-grow: 0; height: 20px; width: 20px;\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div> \n       <div style=\" width: 0; height: 0; border-top: 2px solid transparent; border-left: 6px solid #f4f4f4; border-bottom: 2px solid transparent; transform: translateX(16px) translateY(-4px) rotate(30deg)\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div style=\"margin-left: auto;\"> \n       <div style=\" width: 0px; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-right: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(16px);\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div> \n       <div style=\" background-color: #F4F4F4; flex-grow: 0; height: 12px; width: 16px; transform: translateY(-4px);\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div> \n       <div style=\" width: 0; height: 0; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-left: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(-4px) translateX(8px);\">\n        &nbsp;\n       </div>\n      </div>\n     </div></a> \n    <p style=\" margin:8px 0 0 0; padding:0 4px;\"> <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B90G8gihVaT/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" color:#000; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px; text-decoration:none; word-wrap:break-word;\">COVID-19 Update: Sotto Sotto dining room closed. New Contact-free delivery and takeout. To our dear Sotto Sotto patrons, We take your health and safety very seriously, for this reason, we will be closing Sotto Sotto dining room service starting today. We feel we must do our part to ‘flatten the curve’, and help ensure our collective safety. We look forward to serving you again soon at our Toronto and Oakville locations. New this week - Contact-free delivery: For the first time Sotto Sotto is offering delivery with Contact-free option; much of our full menu will be available, plus larger portion Chef-specials which will be announced regularly on our social channels.  Our strict kitchen safety protocols have been heightened to include all up-to-date recommended precautions from Toronto Public Health. This is done for your safety and peace of mind. Controlled environment pick-up will also be available so that we can continue to offer you the magic and romance of Sotto Sotto. For more information please call us at: SOTTO SOTTO TORONTO: (416)962-0011 SOTTO SOTTO OAKVILLE: (905)844-5545 With love now and always. Stay safe and healthy. Andrà tutto bene, Marisa Rocca, Ristorante Sotto Sotto (owner/founder) @marisarocca27 @sottosotto @sottosottooakville</a></p> \n    <p style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;\">A post shared by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/sottosotto/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px;\"> Sotto Sotto Toronto</a> (@sottosotto) on Mar 16, 2020 at 5:12pm PDT</p>\n   </div>\n  </blockquote> \n </div>\n</div> \n<p>Due to the current global conditions, consumers have been staying indoors — and, as a result, they have become accustomed to doing most activities from their homes, including shopping.</p> \n<p>Retail has been directly impacted by this change in consumer behavior. To stay healthy, people aren't walking into stores and restaurants to make purchases anymore. Instead, they're typically making those transactions online.</p> \n<p>Additionally, the convenience of having items delivered to one's home has changed the shopping experience for consumers. People will likely continue to prefer ecommerce even after the global crisis is over.</p> \n<p>The same goes for pick-ups — although it requires the customer to leave their home and take precautions, the process has become streamlined and requires little interaction. Ultimately, retailers will need to note these conveniences and how effectively they have drawn customers. This is a model that will need to be implemented post-crisis.</p> \n<p>To shift to an ecommerce model, companies need to first research <a href=\"https://www.shipbob.com/blog/ecommerce-shipping/\">competitive shipping prices</a> to get the best deals. Customers want more items shipped, and prohibitive shipping costs might be a deal-breaker for some of your customers.</p> \n<p>The existence of a shipping option also means investing in packaging, which means custom branded boxes and packages will become a mainstay for stores. Brands will also need to be aware of the price and quality of their packaging — they will be expected to invest in <a href=\"https://packhelp.com/sustainable-packaging/\">sustainable packaging</a> to make for a safer future.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, shipping and delivery is a major component of ecommerce and can incentivize customers to become long-term advocates of your brand if implemented successfully.</p> \n<h3>2. More Health and Safety Measures</h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-1.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.worksafebc.com/en/about-us/covid-19-updates/covid-19-returning-safe-operation/retail\" style=\"font-style: italic; font-weight: bold;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>The world has been looking forward to life after COVID-19, but the reality is that we will be adjusting to life <em>with </em>it.</p> \n<p>The hygiene practices initiated during the lockdown procedures will need to be maintained, especially as more retailers open up.</p> \n<p>Companies need to scout out strategic locations around their stores to add sanitizers. More cleaning crews will need to be brought in regularly to disinfect the premises.</p> \n<p>Social distancing measures may have been relaxed in certain parts of the world, but there will be occasional flare-ups. Retailers should prepare to reduce the number of people allowed within their building sites — which could mean a fluctuation in sales and revenue.</p> \n<p>As we have mentioned, curbside pickups and home deliveries will become the norm, but brands need to ensure that these items are handled with care.</p> \n<p>Current staff members are likely already trained on safety measures, but any new members will need to be on-boarded accordingly. Additionally, businesses will need to work to keep their employees safe within the premises.</p> \n<p>The world has changed and we will be feeling the effects for a while after — preparing for a safer working environment can only benefit a business in the long-run.</p> \n<h3>3. Remote Work</h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://news.gallup.com/poll/306695/workers-discovering-affinity-remote-work.aspx\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>Retailers may not be directly impacted by remote work, but their customers will be — and this needs to be factored in when designing the project plan for shifting into ecommerce.</p> \n<p>While stores need their in-store staff to function, a large majority of their customers will <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/remote-work-tips\">continue to work from home</a> for the rest of 2020 and beyond.</p> \n<p>Many companies are also considering making a portion of their staff permanently remote, which will impact how they access retail services like food, clothes, and entertainment.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>4. Diminished Brand Awareness</h3> \n<p>The quarantine period put paid to all theories about brand awareness and loyalty.</p> \n<p>Consumers were so desperate for products that they bought them from whichever brand was available — despite being patrons of other companies for years before.</p> \n<p>And this trend may well continue — the 'get whatever you can' mindset has set in quickly and will be difficult to shake, and the impact on brand awareness will be felt for long after.</p> \n<p>Since the world has had months of needing specific items and grabbing at whatever was available, consumers will find that supporting a single brand isn't always a valuable position for them.</p> \n<p>With so many consumers dipping into multiple brands, retailers will have to work twice as hard to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/brand-awareness\">spread awareness about their business</a>.</p> \n<p>Companies would do well to adapt their brand awareness activities to highlight their ecommerce efforts — such as more online shopping options, delivery, and pickup services.</p> \n<p>Creating messaging that boosts the business' ecommerce aspects and opportunities will go a long way in attracting audiences, as it is relevant and timely.</p> \n<p>Regular updates about health and safety measures will also reassure customers enough to give them an incentive to visit stores.</p> \n<p>Retailers need to accept that competition will be more fraught than before — keep an eye on the gaps that appear in the market and use those as, and when, they appear.</p> \n<p>Consumers have an abundance of choices — narrow down their focus by highlighting the added value you can give them in your ecommerce communication plans.</p> \n<h3>5. Virtual Experiences</h3> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/9pNibZOzslU\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>With remote work becoming more of a norm across the world, retailers will have to find new ways to create memorable experiences and relationships with customers.</p> \n<p>Since consumers won't be visiting stores as often as they used to pre-pandemic, businesses need to look to online sources to create those experiences.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.wishpond.com/post/115675437303/how-to-get-more-likes-on-instagram\">Social media has become a lifeline</a> for most consumers and this is something that businesses can use to promote their products and services.</p> \n<p>Several companies successfully kept their audiences engaged by hosting live streams on YouTube or Instagram Stories of classes, product demos, and expert interviews.</p> \n<p>The need to remain socially distanced and safe has led to retailers creating online versions of their in-house experiences, such as <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/augmented-reality-retail\">virtual dressing rooms and fittings</a>.</p> \n<p>Businesses can also create AR filters on Instagram and Snapchat for consumers to try on products like makeup and clothes, as well as for gamification.</p> \n<p>The more online a business can be in the future, the better they will be able to engage with their customers.</p> \n<h3>6. Offer Discounts and Gift Cards</h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-3.png?width=456&amp;name=The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-3.png\" alt=\"\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 456px;\" width=\"456\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://saveourfaves.org/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>The pandemic has hit a large contingent of consumers very hard — and this hardship is set to continue.</p> \n<p>Spending ability and disposable income will decrease as a result, which means businesses will have to work twice as hard to incentivize customers to purchase from them.</p> \n<p>Brands should look at a more cohesive <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/customer-centric\">customer-centric approach</a> to their marketing — giving customers a reason to consistently engage with the brand.</p> \n<p>To mitigate reduced consumer spending, retail brands should offer more discounts, package deals, and special offers.</p> \n<p>Employ incentives to encourage customers to use your ecommerce services — it will act as an advertisement for your virtual platforms, which users are more interested in now.</p> \n<p>Discounts can also help in amplifying sales of underperforming product categories — they look more lucrative with a smaller price tag and will sell better, reducing inventory.</p> \n<p>Gift cards are a great way to assure future business while bringing in immediate revenue.</p> \n<h3>7. Review Supplier Orders</h3> \n<p>There is still so much uncertainty around which items will move quickly that having excess inventory as a restaurant or a retailer could lead to revenue losses in 2020.</p> \n<p>Retailers should be identifying overstocked items in their warehouses. You'll want to determine which items aren't selling well, and order fewer of those.</p> \n<p>Of course, it's important not to be out of stock of popular items, as that will impact sales — there is a delicate balance that has to be reached here.</p> \n<p>An <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/inventory-management\">inventory management system</a> will help to track items in stock and determine which ones are selling out faster than others.</p> \n<p>To ensure inventories aren't full, retailers should work with their suppliers to slow down the production of certain items — if ecommerce sales pick up, production can be increased.</p> \n<p>Also, you'll want to look into setting up longer payment delivery methods for suppliers — this will help companies retain capital and keep the business afloat until more sales are made.</p> \n<h3>8. Loyalty Marketing</h3> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-2.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www2.hm.com/en_us/member/info.html\"><em><span style=\"font-size: 11px;\">Image Source</span></em></a></p> \n<p>Repeat customers make up the bulk of revenue and profits for most businesses — building a loyal community of customers is thus a priority, especially during such uncertain times.</p> \n<p>Focusing the business' efforts on loyalty marketing will make a difference to the bottom line and should be included in your ecommerce project plan.</p> \n<p>For the rest of 2020, brands will need to work on getting more loyal customers — incentives like discounts have been known to work in this area.</p> \n<p>But to create genuine brand loyalty, a few discounts here and there won't make a huge impact.</p> \n<p>This is where <a href=\"https://appinstitute.com/customer-loyalty-programs/\">customer loyalty programs</a> can be a huge draw. A points system that rewards customers for buying improves engagement and repeat sales.</p> \n<p>Another way to improve consumer loyalty is through subscription services.</p> \n<p>Ecommerce subscriptions have been the basis of many successful business models, in a variety of fields, and they can help businesses boost customer loyalty.</p> \n<p>Subscriptions and loyalty programs give brands a database of people to regularly contact to improve sales — for companies that haven't instituted these, 2020 will be the best time to do so.</p> \n<p>The pandemic is changing the way businesses function, but ecommerce is quickly proving to be a safe model of work that companies can adopt.</p> \n<p>Since ecommerce isn't an arena that all companies are familiar with, to prepare for the shift, here are the steps businesses should include in their project scope:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Investing in pickup and delivery services</li> \n <li>Instituting more health and safety measures</li> \n <li>Acknowledging customers' remote working needs</li> \n <li>Adjusting for diminished brand awareness</li> \n <li>Creating more virtual experiences</li> \n <li>Offering discounts and gift cards</li> \n <li>Reviewing supplier orders and inventory management</li> \n <li>Focusing on loyalty marketing and subscription services</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Following these eight steps will help businesses move safely into an ecommerce environment to improve their sales in the future. Additionally, consider investing in <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ecommerce-software\">high-quality ecommerce software</a> to get your company up-to-speed quickly.&nbsp;</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fretailers-adapt-crisis&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 12 Aug 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":924,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-1.png","linkMd5":"68d546ebacc964f8c37729dcc2478b44","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn95@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-28-390_2a818b6056bb5ca2.webp","author":"Ronita Mohan","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn27@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-34-788_2a818b6056bb5ca2.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn40@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-39-997_72d72b880265c7c8.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-3.png?width=456&name=The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn48@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-31-307_3f0f7847502bf1e9.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Move%20to%20Ecommerce%20How%20Retailers%20Can%20Adapt%20During%20a%20Crisis-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn15@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-35-591_7f545fef13cfd545.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fretailers-adapt-crisis&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn23@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-38-097_fafbc9d66d124900.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:25","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:25","title":"How to Adapt Your Content Into an Instagram Story, According to HubSpot Marketers","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/adapting-instagram-story-content","description":"<p>If you're a marketer, at some point, it's likely you're going to be asked the question, \"Is it on brand?\"</p>  \n<p>This is especially true for social media content. Companies with social media pages generally have a theme that relates to the organization. The use of colors, sensory details, and styling all contribute to the overall theme of a page. I, for one, <em>love </em>thematic Instagrams — they're so aesthetically pleasing.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>When the colors, text, and photos all fit, I find myself going through all the content because it's so easy to look at — the same is true for Stories.</p> \n<p>Sometimes, I come across posts that make me think, \"How did this marketer turn a simple content idea into this engaging Instagram Story?\" And, as always, curiosity got the best of me. I had a question, and I was ready to search for the answer.</p> \n<p>Fortunately, I knew exactly who to look to for help. I wanted to know just how social media marketers choose the right pieces to include in Stories, so I turned to the experts. I asked HubSpot's marketers this question and compiled their tips.</p> \n<p>Let's see what they had to say.</p> \n<h3>1. Look for buzzy, trendy content.</h3> \n<p>When choosing content to add to Instagram Stories, HubSpot Audience Growth Writer Pam Bump, asks herself a question: “<em>Is the content buzz-worthy?</em>”</p> \n<p>\"Trend or buzz-worthy content usually relates to a topic, trend, or piece of research that people in my industry are talking about or sharing on social media,\" she says. \"If a topic is already being widely discussed and shared, it might be more engaging as a story on a social platform.\"</p> \n<p>For instance, if you find that a hot topic in your industry is, say, personality tests, and you have a blog post all about them, think about how you can adapt that into a story.</p> \n<p>Check out this example from HubSpot:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-3.png?width=252&amp;name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-3.png\" alt=\"Example of content broken up in a story.\" width=\"252\" style=\"width: 252px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p>This story corresponds with a post about <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/personality-tests\">free personality tests</a>. It takes the main ideas from the article and uses short, digestible sentences to recap the content. Additionally, the story's following tiles included a few of the options outlined in the blog:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-4.png?width=252&amp;name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-4.png\" alt=\"Example of reforming content into an Instagram story.\" width=\"252\" style=\"width: 252px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>This tile includes a \"<a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/insights/instagram-swipe-up/\">Swipe Up</a>\" function, so audiences can see the post and get details about the test. Remember, the swipe-up tool is a great one to use for backlinking. You can bring new browsers to your website without making them exit the app.</p> \n<p>Sharing buzz-worthy content will throw your company into the conversation and keep the content fresh and topical on your page.</p> \n<h3>2. Choose media that's easy to comprehend.</h3> \n<p>When you want to adapt content, think about what can be split up into small, comprehensive pieces. If an audience member is scrolling through Instagram during their lunch break, it's likely that they're not interested in reading Stories that are full of text.</p> \n<p>\"Odds are, much of your audience is on Instagram looking for quick entertainment during a work break or daily commute,\" notes Kelsey Yamada, one of HubSpot's social media managers. \"This is why my most important tip is to start your story actively rather than passively.\"</p> \n<p>Yamada suggests that, to keep audiences engaged, \"Grab the reader’s attention with an interactive element, interesting fast-fact, a video, or eye-popping graphic. Then, use the following pages of the story to go into depth about the topic.\"</p> \n<p>Let's look at a visual:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-Aug-10-2020-03-07-49-67-AM.png?width=252&amp;name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-Aug-10-2020-03-07-49-67-AM.png\" width=\"252\" style=\"width: 252px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"Example of starting a story interactively.\">\n</div> \n<p>This first tile asks the reader a question to get them thinking. The Story doesn't use much text, and instead, includes an interactive function — the<a href=\"https://about.instagram.com/blog/announcements/introducing-the-emoji-slider-sticker\"> emoji slider sticker</a>. The next tile gives survey data to add background.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-2.png?width=252&amp;name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-2.png\" alt=\"How to present data in an Instagram Story.\" width=\"252\" style=\"width: 252px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>This content is easy for audiences to engage with as a quick brain break from their busy day. It takes data that was previously collected by HubSpot and turns it into a visually appealing guess-and-check for marketers.</p> \n<p>You can use stats, like survey data, for Instagram Stories. Use short questions to engage users right off the bat, then use the following tiles to give them the full story.</p> \n<h3>3. Think about if you can make the story interactive.</h3> \n<p>One question Bump asks herself when choosing content for Stories is, <em>\"Can I make this content interactive?\" </em>For instance, you might have some less-than-glamorous topics covered on your blog or web pages, but take a look at them from a different perspective.</p> \n<p>Bump notes, \"Even a bland topic can be zested up with a quiz or poll. For example, sometimes, when adapting a post with heavy research into an Instagram Story, we’ll format the story like a quiz. Then the last page will offer readers the ability to swipe up to read more about the answers.\"</p> \n<p>For example, this story was adapted from a post about the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/millennials-vs-gen-z?_ga=2.251058054.1692937882.1597029621-940436819.1565181751\">difference between millennials and Gen Z</a>:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers.png?width=252&amp;name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers.png\" alt=\"How to capture audiences with statistical content in an Instagram Story.\" width=\"252\" style=\"width: 252px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>It might not be the most exciting topic, but using Instagram Stories can make the content interactive, raising the interest level of audiences. If I were to see this story before the blog post, I would stop in my tracks and ask myself, <em>\"I think I know the difference, but what does HubSpot have to say?\"</em></p> \n<p>Alternatively, if I saw the blog post, I might not want to engage. But this story makes the content fun, gives the value of the post, and brings readers to the content in a new format. If the last tile included a link to the post, you could boost the number of reads.</p> \n<h3>4. Decide if you can make the text sparse and actionable.</h3> \n<p>\"One thing the social media teams I’ve worked with are mindful of are the amount of text and the amount of pages in each story. I’ve seen that more than a paragraph of text on one story page can result in reader fatigue, which, in turn, could cause people to drop out of your story,\" notes Yamada.</p> \n<p>Remember, it's likely that your Instagram audiences are checking their feeds as a quick brain break or a source of entertainment. Bombarding them with text-filled stories will take away from that experience.</p> \n<p>Instead of using a paragraph of text, include bullet points. This will break up text and allow for emojis, stickers, or other content that will make a story visually appealing.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-1.png?width=252&amp;name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-1.png\" alt=\"Example of a story with little text.\" width=\"252\" style=\"width: 252px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>\"If you can include a swipe-up with more content, consider a less-is-more approach where you include a quick tip, poll, or quiz related to a topic. Then, encourage the reader to swipe-up to learn more about the topic,\" recommends Yamada. \"If you can’t, but the story is more complex, consider breaking it up into a larger amount of pages.\"</p> \n<h3>5. Experiment, experiment, experiment.</h3> \n<p>What works for HubSpot's socials might not be the case for companies in different industries. So, remember to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-testing?_ga=2.19779768.1692937882.1597029621-940436819.1565181751\">experiment with your content</a> to find what works the best for your audience.</p> \n<p>Bump recalls, \"While you should do research and keep social media manager guidelines in mind as you craft a story strategy, don’t be afraid to try something different. For example, if you have a low drop off rate and most of your audience gets to the end of your Stories, you could experiment with a longer story to see how far they’ll get.\"</p> \n<p>Don't be afraid to think outside of the box. Sometimes, new ideas are the ones that will be the winning ticket to better engagement. That sales metric that you're unsure about sharing? Experiment with it, and see if you can change the wording to make it enjoyable.</p> \n<p>\"Regardless of which experiments you do,\" Bump continues, \"Be sure to start with a hypothesis, know which metrics you’ll be monitoring, and identify what you’ll do if the experiment works or doesn’t work. This will allow you to develop a strong set of learnings around your audience and their behaviors.\"</p> \n<p>As for metrics to look for, Bump recommends looking at story views, impressions, swipe ups, and exits. Outside of the app, analyze overall Instagram traffic, or use a tracking URL. \" If you include a swipe-up to your full web content, use a tracking URL, such as one made with HubSpot or <a href=\"http://bit.ly/\">Bit.ly</a>, as your swipe-up link,\" she says.</p> \n<p>\"A tracking URL will allow you to see how many page views you received from the story. If you have a CMS with an analytics dashboard that can distinguish social media sources, like <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/analytics?_ga=2.19779768.1692937882.1597029621-940436819.1565181751\">HubSpot</a>, you can also see how much traffic your post has coming from Instagram.\"</p> \n<h3>6. Be mindful of story length.</h3> \n<p>We've talked a bit about keeping the audience's attention. The length of your story could impact their engagement. So when you're choosing content, think about how many tiles it would take to convey the message. Can you do this in less than five?</p> \n<p>Yamada says, \"If someone doesn’t get to the end of your story where a swipe-up link is located, they won’t swipe up. So, I try to keep Instagram Stories content within 4-5 pages if it will include a swipe-up.\"</p> \n<p>Remember, in our personality test example, the story had five tiles. At the end of the last tile, there was a link to the corresponding blog post. This captures the reader's attention quickly and backlinks the source before they exit:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-Aug-10-2020-03-07-49-38-AM.png?width=252&amp;name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-Aug-10-2020-03-07-49-38-AM.png\" alt=\"How to shorten content for an Instagram Story.\" width=\"252\" style=\"width: 252px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>\"Do your best to cut the content down to the biggest takeaways. If your audience wants all the details, provide a link to the source material in a swipe-up or in the DMs if anyone reaches out. If a piece of content can't be summarized and cut down, it's not the best fit for Stories,\" Yamada explains.</p> \n<p>In the example above, the content explains a test the audience can take, where they can find it, and how to get more information. Basically, the story is used as a \"preview\" for the rest of the content. Is there content in your arsenal that's similar — like a study you just performed?</p> \n<h3>7. Put yourself in the audience's shoes.</h3> \n<p>Keeping your audience in mind is at the forefront of content creation. Remember to think about their motivation as much as their interests.</p> \n<p>\"Whenever I’ve adapted long-form content into Instagram, Snapchat, or Facebook Stories, I’ve tried to imagine what my audience will be doing and thinking when they aimlessly tap through Stories and come across my brand’s,\" states Yamada.</p> \n<p>Think about how you interact with Stories on Instagram. A story that's short, simple, and includes visual elements probably keeps you more interested than a story that's too busy, with a lot of moving parts. It's jarring to tap to a story and see a huge video with no explanation, right?</p> \n<p>To choose content that your audience will be intrigued by, Bump encourages marketers to \"Think about what your audience likes to see from you on Instagram. If you get a ton of engagement on sales-related content, for example, try adapting a blog post about sales into a short-form story.\"</p> \n<p>As Yamada notes, \"Adapting your existing content into stories will give it the opportunity to provide value on a different platform to a different audience.\" If your audience misses content you want to boost, or you want to present it in a different way, take to your Stories to give it more exposure.</p> \n<p>Adapting your content into stories gives audiences a rounded view of what your brand is about from a different perspective.</p> \n<p>\"Why shouldn't more people see the awesome content you've already worked on creating?\" she asks. \"You'll also find yourself saving time when adapting content, as you won't have to create a whole new piece just for Stories. A win-win!\"</p> \n<p>These tips made me excited to jump into my content and see what I could turn into the next high-performing story. I can't wait to find new data or research that I can make more engaging with a few emojis. Plus, I feel more confident about what I can put out there. Knowing I have a solid direction now, I'm ready to be bold and experiment.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fadapting-instagram-story-content&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 10 Aug 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":924,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/instagram-adpation-1.jpg#keepProtocol","linkMd5":"fd66ed0e00a3e13ef6a55f730a8ae237","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn88@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-27-405_f767e5b1202e163f.webp","metaImg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/instagram-adpation-1.jpg#keepProtocol","author":"Kayla Carmicheal","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-3.png?width=252&name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn76@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-37-838_8a4e63b807fb70f1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-4.png?width=252&name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-33-503_306424884d76024e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-Aug-10-2020-03-07-49-67-AM.png?width=252&name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-Aug-10-2020-03-07-49-67-AM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn7@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-37-056_3f5a157e622ceb1e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-2.png?width=252&name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx17/cdn20@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-29-636_58c6ab9a852d7d10.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers.png?width=252&name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn71@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-34-290_68f4f2181a72d550.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-1.png?width=252&name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn68@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-34-273_8b25fdeed94f8e54.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-Aug-10-2020-03-07-49-38-AM.png?width=252&name=How%20to%20Adapt%20Your%20Content%20Into%20an%20Instagram%20Story,%20According%20to%20HubSpot%20Marketers-Aug-10-2020-03-07-49-38-AM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn95@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-39-707_2290e3e6f21ccf61.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fadapting-instagram-story-content&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn56@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-36-463_4945f28b0e43f6fc.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:27","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:27","title":"How HubSpot Personalized Our Chatbots to Improve The Customer Experience and Support Our Sales Team","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/chatbots-improve-customer-experience-experiment","description":"<p><em>This post is a part of Made @ HubSpot, an internal thought&nbsp; leadership series through which we extract lessons from experiments conducted by our very own HubSpotters.</em></p> \n<p>You can’t talk about the future of marketing without chatbots. People are increasingly interested in communicating with brands in a more <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/customers/chat-new-hubspot-conversations\">personal, conversational way</a> — and chatbots can help.</p>  \n<p>Including chatbots on your website helps visitors find what they are looking for and connect them with your team in an immediate, frictionless way. Chatbots also follow the Inbound Messaging Framework.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/chatbots-improve-customer-experience-experiment-1.png?width=1500&amp;name=chatbots-improve-customer-experience-experiment-1.png\" alt=\"chatbots inbound messaging framework\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>So, what are the secrets to building a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-build-a-chatbot\">chatbot strategy</a>?</p> \n<p>On HubSpot’s marketing team, we seek to deliver a world-class customer experience. We consistently ask: How can <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-ai-chatbot\">chatbots</a> better serve our various audiences (visitors, leads, and customers) to help direct them to the right resources for their needs? Also, how can we use chatbots to support our sales team and reach our goals?</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm/chatbot-builder\"><em>Use HubSpot's free Chatbot Builder Software to easily build and launch chatbots on your website — no coding required.</em></a></p> \n<h2>A Customer-Focused Bot Experience</h2> \n<p>Chatbots work when they're contextual and relevant to specific problems folks are having. Through conversations with our sales team, we learned that 15% of chat questions on the website were about getting technical support. We were creating friction for our customers because our sales team (who answers chat questions onsite) is not as well equipped to answer these questions as our <em>support</em> team is.</p> \n<p>So, we created a bot to direct our customers to the right resources for technical support (our support team, knowledgebase, and community). If they were not looking for technical support, we passed their questions about HubSpot features and pricing to our sales team.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/chatbots-improve-customer-experience-experiment-2.png?width=1500&amp;name=chatbots-improve-customer-experience-experiment-2.png\" alt=\"chatbots improve customer experience\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>We rolled out these bots across the primary site pages and saw an <strong>80% increase</strong> in our sales team efficiency: a measure of success based on the number of meetings we booked divided by the total number of chats handled. And, it was a far better customer experience, as our customers could access technical support more easily.</p> \n<p>It was a big win, but our work was hardly done. As we took a step back, we realized that this “support bot” experience was not serving all of our users. About <strong>70% of our audience is visitors and leads</strong>, compared with 30% who are users and customers. This first bot experience was designed with only 30% of our audience in mind. Ignoring 70% of our audience meant we were leaving money on the table.</p> \n<h2>A Personalized Experience for All Visitors</h2> \n<p>We needed to create a personalized experience for the visitor and lead audiences, too.</p> \n<p>With the “support bot” experience, it was odd to ask visitors and leads if they needed support when we knew they weren’t using our tools yet. Rather than directing visitors and leads to chat or support, we wanted to give these visitors their own “self-help” option. Why not give them the option to get started for free with the HubSpot CRM? That way they could start using our free tools or chat with our sales team about features and pricing for advanced tools.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/chatbots-improve-customer-experience-experiment-3-1.png?width=1500&amp;name=chatbots-improve-customer-experience-experiment-3-1.png\" alt=\"hubspot hubbot example\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>Now we had designed <em>two</em> personalized experiences: one for those already using our software (customers) <em>and</em> those who had yet to experience it (visitors).</p> \n<p>We believed this to be a better experience for each audience, because it offered <strong>contextual options based on their relationship with HubSpot</strong>. However, we wanted to test it first with an experiment.</p> \n<h2>Setting Up the Experiment</h2> \n<p>In order to test our hypothesis that this would be a better experience for both of these users, we set up an A/B test on one of our product pages so we could see exactly how the bot for visitors performed against the current bot experience (designed for customers).</p> \n<p>First, we defined our metrics for success. We looked at:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Sales team efficiency: # of meetings booked by our sales team ÷ the number of chats they handled</li> \n <li># of signups for the CRM</li> \n</ul> \n<p>We also compared these for each bot (control vs. variant), and by each audience (visitors vs. customer).</p> \n<p>We chose one of our product pages and directed 50% of its site traffic to a cloned page with the new bot experience. The test was live and ready to run for one month while we waited (somewhat) patiently for the results.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/chatbots-improve-customer-experience-experiment-4.gif?width=480&amp;name=chatbots-improve-customer-experience-experiment-4.gif\" alt=\"chatbots improve customer experience gif\" width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 13px;\"><em>Me, waiting at my desk</em></p> \n<h2>Experiment Results</h2> \n<p>We isolated our results for the audience the test was focused on: visitors. We looked at how the control (support bot) performed against the variant (lead bot).</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Sales team efficiency: increased by almost 70% in the variant</li> \n <li># of CRM signups: increased by 7%</li> \n</ul> \n<p>The increase in CRM signups indicated that visitors were finding the right option for them (starting for free) and diving in to try out our software for free.</p> \n<p>As a result, fewer chats reached our sales team, but we saw a similar number of meetings booked to continue the sales conversation after a chat. This meant a couple of things:</p> \n<ol> \n <li>The sales team was able to spend more time and focus on higher quality chats that were more likely to turn into sales</li> \n <li>We weren’t losing demand, because we still saw a similar number of meetings booked. We were still capturing those interested in having a sales conversation, just in a more efficient way.</li> \n</ol> \n<p><strong>Better segmentation makes life better for everyone.</strong> Making a bot personalized for visitors helped the customers’ bot perform better as well. We learned the customer bot works very well for the audience it was designed for — performing 52% better when shown only to customers than when it was shown to all visitors.</p> \n<h2>Takeaways for Your Business</h2> \n<p>It’s important to recognize that different segments of your audience have different problems and what works for one audience isn't the best for another. By understanding the problems that our visitors are facing, and personalizing their <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm/chatbot-builder\">chatbot</a> experience onsite, you can create a better prospect <em>and</em> customer experience. When you anticipate the help that people need better, your metrics will improve as well.</p> \n<p>And you may be thinking, “OK, that sounds pretty good for HubSpot, but what about my business? How can I create a more contextual bot experience for my business?” Here’s how:</p> \n<ol> \n <li>Create a list of the various audiences you are serving on your website.</li> \n <li>For each audience, describe the types of questions they might have.</li> \n <li>Determine the resources or people who can best answer those questions so you can help them find what they are looking for faster and with less friction.</li> \n</ol> \n<p><strong>Then implement it!</strong> The <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm/conversations\">HubSpot Conversations tool</a> gives you the ability to target your chat flows with segmented lists based on data in your CRM so you can create a personalized experience as well.</p> \n<p>Chatbots work shoulder-to-shoulder alongside with our sales team to provide an excellent, personalized purchase experience that also helps us identify visitors who are possible good fit customers.</p> \n<p>Chatbots can do the same for your business and audience.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in July 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>&nbsp;</p>  \n<img
