tps://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn71@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-32-321_50414ee3d54d1698.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/whitepaper-example-hubspot.jpg?width=518&name=whitepaper-example-hubspot.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn12@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-31-858_bef8ffa4425fbc37.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/checklist-example-opendoor.jpg?width=600&name=checklist-example-opendoor.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn87@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-30-977_b27ba6b322585430.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/tool-example-nerdwallet.jpg?width=600&name=tool-example-nerdwallet.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn76@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-35-765_446d3fc84b5d7fc1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/tip-sheet-example-coschedule.jpg?width=600&name=tip-sheet-example-coschedule.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn91@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-37-943_9259d489759d59b5.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/webinar-example-semrush.jpg?width=600&name=webinar-example-semrush.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn36@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-32-014_7ba55bd01717c241.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/comparison-example-verwell-fit.jpg?width=600&name=comparison-example-verwell-fit.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn28@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-31-221_4e78a0d872020c1d.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/case-study-example-bluleadz.jpg?width=600&name=case-study-example-bluleadz.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn20@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-35-493_615c59fbebbeecaa.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/free-sample-example-4colorprint.jpg?width=600&name=free-sample-example-4colorprint.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx17/cdn60@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-34-132_305ae7ca71eb677f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/free-trial-example-hellosign.jpg?width=600&name=free-trial-example-hellosign.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-28-600_639806cbb019b82a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/consultation-offer-blkbld-co.jpg?width=600&name=consultation-offer-blkbld-co.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn71@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-38-722_d75ac3ef5285f42f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/coupon-example-fragrant-jewels.jpg?width=500&name=coupon-example-fragrant-jewels.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn52@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-30-536_18ef180261f6c87c.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fcontent-for-every-funnel-stage&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-29-768_b13e222cfe2c4cb5.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:27","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:27","title":"19 Impressive Product Demo Videos You'll Want to Copy","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/demo-video","description":"<p>In marketing these days, you can’t swing an enthusiastic micro-influencer without hitting someone who’s talking about video content. And it’s not without merit. A <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/news-trends/content-trends-preferences\">recent HubSpot study</a> revealed 54% of consumers want to see more video content from brands and businesses they support.</p> \n<p>With video marketers earning <a href=\"https://optinmonster.com/video-marketing-statistics-what-you-must-know/\">66% more qualified leads</a> per year and a 54% increase in brand awareness, it’s clear video marketing is the future and product demo videos are a lucrative path forward.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>In fact, <a href=\"https://www.wyzowl.com/video-marketing-statistics-2018/\">72% of people</a> would rather use video to learn about a product or service. There are many different types of product demo videos, so I’m sharing a few of my favorites below, along with tips on how to get started on your own product demo video.</p> \n<p>Want to skip straight to the videos? <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/demo-video#demo-video-examples\">Click here</a>.</p> \n<h3>1. Identify the goal</h3> \n<p>Purchases? Subscriptions? Education? Brand awareness? Decide what your video is trying to achieve and what you want the viewer to walk away with. What action do you hope the viewer takes after watching your video, and what business need does it fulfill? For example, “<em>After watching our product demo video, we hope the viewer submits a demo request form</em>.”</p> \n<h3>2. Determine your audience</h3> \n<p>Has the audience for this video purchased with you before? Are you introducing a new product or feature to them? Or is this video reaching people who have never heard of you? What will this audience be concerned with? How long will they want to watch? What buyer persona will you be gearing this video for?</p> \n<p>All of these are important questions to answer. For example, let’s say you’re introducing software that regulates the temperature of various areas in your office. The audience for your video might be harried office managers who are constantly fielding requests to turn the temperature up or down. They’re concerned with keeping their colleagues comfortable without breaking the bank on electricity costs.</p> \n<h3>3. Set a budget (and a timeline)</h3> \n<p>Do you have $7000 or $80,000 to make this product demo video? Identify your budget so you know how to proceed. This is also the time to set expectations. If you have a $500 budget, you’re not going to come out with a video on par with Apple’s latest release -- and that’s alright.</p> \n<p>Oh, and don’t forget to outline when you need this video to be completed. Even the biggest budgets can run up against roadblocks, if the timeline is too limited.</p> \n<h3>4. Decide between in-house or agency</h3> \n<p>This decision will likely be dependent on your budget. If you have a lot to work with, interview agencies who can give you quotes and creative pitches for your project.</p> \n<p>If you have a small budget, don’t let that dissuade you from creating a video using your iPhone. You can also record a video of your computer screen while moving through your platform. Work with what you have and be proud of whatever you create.</p> \n<h3>5. Structure your video</h3> \n<p>Will you tell a story? Highlight pain points? Use text or visuals only? Decide how you want to communicate your goal and how you’ll bring it to life.</p> \n<p>If you’re working with a creative agency or freelance videographer, they may help you define the structure. If you’re going it alone, use videos like the ones we’ve listed below to inspire you and define which format will work best for your product and goals.</p> \n<h3>6. Choose between animation and live-action</h3> \n<p>Animation can sometimes be a little cheaper than live-action video. Work within your budget and skill level, and be honest about which option best highlights what your product can do and the scope your project requires.</p> \n<h3>7. Write a script</h3> \n<p>The script is a crucial part of your video. It defines the tone, pace, and message. Start with a project brief, move on to an outline, and navigate your script, section by section, making sure it speaks to the goals you’ve previously outlined.</p> \n<p>Call out opportunities for B-roll throughout, and always conduct a verbal run-through before getting behind the camera.</p> \n<p>For more tips and a video script template, check out this blog post and accompanying video on <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-write-a-video-script-ht?_ga=2.204163794.394907747.1559842484-112379962.1552485402\">how to write a video script</a>.</p> \n<h3>8. Create a marketing plan</h3> \n<p>Once you’ve shot, edited, and finalized your video, it’s time to decide how you’ll <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/video-distribution-checklist?_ga=2.204163794.394907747.1559842484-112379962.1552485402\">share it with your audience</a>. YouTube, your website or campaign landing pages, and special email campaigns are all great channels for distribution.</p> \n<p>But don’t overlook less obvious opportunities, like including your video in your email signature, sharing it in partner blog posts, and incorporating it into your sales team’s pitches.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>Product Demo Video Examples</h2> \n<h3>1. Beauty Bakerie</h3> \n<p>This pleasant demo from <a href=\"https://www.beautybakerie.com/\">Beauty Bakerie</a>'s CEO and Co-Founder Cashmere Nicole Carillo highlights the brand's new concealer, foundation and makeup setting mist. Cashmere begins the demo with no makeup on to show her fans what the makeup will look like realistically as she puts it on her face.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>While the demo allows viewers to see what the products will look like in real life, Cashmere also gives instructions on how to use it so they'll also know just how easy it is to add to their daily beauty routine.</p> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/oBFN9FwcpPw\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>2. Airtable</h3> \n<p>This classic product demo video uses animation and the Airtable product to show users exactly who can use their product and how they can benefit from it. The video demonstrates several different use cases, taking a broad, top-of-the-funnel approach that will attract the masses.</p> \n<p>They also do something else incredibly smart. As seconds tick by and viewers hypothetically click out of the video, the information shared gets more into the weeds sharing specific tactics and features. Airtable knows if someone has stuck around over one minute into their demo video, this is likely a qualified lead who wants to learn more.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/r0lsyTaAuJE\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>3. Zendesk Sunshine</h3> \n<p>Zendesk leads with pain points in their product demo video. “Customer relationships are complicated … made up of fragmented pieces of what you know about your customers … it’s kind of all over the place,” a narrator explains. But Zendesk gets it. “What seems like chaos is actually everything you want.”</p> \n<p>The viewer immediately feels like Zendesk understands them. It’s a full 50 seconds into the video before Zendesk even introduces a solution. We never actually see the platform at work, but that’s not really the goal of this video.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/buRG1eGuPIs\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>4. SurveyMonkey</h3> \n<p>At nearly two-minutes long, this is a lengthy product demo video. But it packs a powerful punch with text-based benefits and features, and a walk-through of the product interface.</p> \n<p>Viewers see just how easy it is to send a survey using SurveyMonkey. They even see how it integrates with other platforms like Slack. This is a workhorse of a demo video, but the viewer witnesses how SurveyMonkey can integrate into their daily workflow -- and how easy the product is to use, from sign-in to send.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/PnET-g7NTao\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>5. Headspace</h3> \n<p>Is there anything harder to sell on the internet than meditation? Headspace makes it seem easy with their modern, relatable animated product demo video.</p> \n<p>They offer a “healthier, happier life” and show you how the app works for a variety of users with differing goals and time. It’s an inclusive video that communicates a lot without overwhelming the viewer.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/CS76mK58urI\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>6. Esusu Financial</h3> \n<p>Esusu, an app created by <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/elisabethbrier/2020/06/05/75-black-owned-businesses-to-support/#1f8f8b563814\">Forbes 30 Under 30 social entrepreneurs Abbey Wemimo and Samir Goel</a>, aims to help people in marginalized locations with financial planning. The demo created by the company gives viewers a look inside Esusu;s platform and the tools it has to offer.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Specifically, this demo walks through how families can use the platform together to build each member's credit, save funds together, or send funds to each other.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/3xFnN6t7pwU\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<p>One great thing about the intro above is that it establishes a pain point by asking the audience if they've ever dealt with bad credit or poor savings. Then, it highlights exactly how Esusu can help them.</p> \n<p>This demo is also a great example of how a quick and simple tour of an app can show potential users exactly what they need to know about navigating and using this type of financial planning app.</p> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>7. Apple’s iPhone XS, XS Max, and XR</h3> \n<p>This glossy product video introduces the new iPhone XR by showing what it can do. Simple text alerts the viewer to the features this new phone possesses (e.g., “liquid retina,” “face ID,” and “water resistant”), and the benefits are communicated through the vivid visuals.</p> \n<p>The goal of this product demo is to \"wow\" rather than educate, and that’s exactly what it does.</p> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/9m_K2Yg7wGQ\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>8. Slack</h3> \n<p>Slack uses this brightly hued video to break down a common misconception about their platform: that it’s only for sending private messages. They walk viewers through how teams can communicate using their interface.</p> \n<p>“It’s way more than just a place to talk,” explains the actor, “We keep all of our files here too.” The video is feature-heavy, but the actor chimes in with how those features translate into benefits as he walks viewers through a demonstration of Slack. A simple “Get started with Slack, today” closes out this informative video.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/6c7_TpPUpL0\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>9. The Origins of Nike Free</h3> \n<p>This product demo tells the origin story of the Nike Free running shoes. The shoe creators share a bit about how the shoe was designed and call out benefits like, “More natural movement” and “Nice, modern evolution.” A simple tagline at the end reads, “Engineered for modern motion.”</p> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/BITz7GEqA8s\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>10. Duolingo</h3> \n<p>Duolingo kicks things off with social proof. “Far and away the best free language-learning app,” says The Wall Street Journal. What follows is a description of how the platform works, backed with more data on how effective it really is.</p> \n<p>If you want to prove that your product works, sometimes facts are more alluring than a demo of the product itself.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/SUz6oBiRlxk\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>11. IKEA Place</h3> \n<p>There’s nothing wrong with stating your purpose up front. “Hey, IKEA would like everyone to know about Place, our new augmented reality app,” explains this demo video. What follows is a demonstration of the app, and a video montage of people struggling to design and furnish new spaces. “We want to make it easier for people everywhere to imagine a better place,” the narrator explains. That’s exactly what this video demo does.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/UudV1VdFtuQ\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>12. NoseFrida</h3> \n<p>Your baby is cute, until she’s not. The narrator explains what happens to a baby’s nose when they’re sick -- and why your baby gets fussy. Immediately, he’s identified the viewer’s pain points and explained the problem with NoseFrida’s competitors.</p> \n<p>The narrator begins to explain how to use the NoseFrida -- a device that allows parents to physically suck snot out of their baby’s nose and effectively ruins your days of carefree milkshake sipping forever (take it from me).</p> \n<p>It’s here that the company does something brilliant. They know their customer’s biggest purchasing block is the gross-out factor this product elicits, so they confront it head on. “Breathe easy, we know what you’re thinking.”</p> \n<p>The narrator then explains how NoseFrida is designed to be hygienic and safe. Know your product has a big red flag for customers? Try addressing it bravely, like NoseFrida does, instead of tip-toeing around the elephant in the room.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/UsLFKfGuioE\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>13. Bluprint</h3> \n<p>How do you get people to part with their most valuable asset: their free time? Online learning platform Bluprint does just that. They overcome viewer objections early on. Think you don’t have time? “There’s always a way to get your creative fix,” the narrator explains.</p> \n<p>The video takes an aspirational lens, showing people cooking, painting, and dancing. It ends with a call to action, “What will you do today?” Bluprint knows what they’re up against, and their demo video is a strong rebuttal against inactivity.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/BMat3J64OTg\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>14. Sphero</h3> \n<p>Are you known for one product but want to introduce another? Sphero knows a little about that. A few years ago, they created a robot called BB-8 for a little-known movie called <em>Star Wars: The Force Awakens</em>. Lucky for them, I hear that panned out.</p> \n<p>In a Kickstarter video for their newest robot, they begin by featuring the iconic BB-8 robot that skyrocketed their success. Once the viewer knows who they are, they present their new robot: The Sphero RVR.</p> \n<p>The rest of the video features the robot’s engineers speaking about what their new creation does and why it’s special. We believe them, because they’ve tethered this new creation to their past authority.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ip28n_prmbY\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>15. Ring Door View Cam</h3> \n<p>This is another great example of showing instead of telling viewers what your product can do. The video shows everyday people using Ring’s Door View Cam in a variety of ways. We see them use the mobile interface, benefit from the speaker, and avoid danger using the camera.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/WJ-iMF5hKgk\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>16. Lime</h3> \n<p>Text that reads, “How to Lime” kicks this video off and tells viewers exactly what to expect. We see a step-by-step demonstration of how to use Lime, their safety recommendations, and some basics on their mobile app.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/zOMYOBBRtM8\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>17. Peloton</h3> \n<p>This product video begins with an origin story of the Peloton bicycle and quickly moves to the benefits (i.e., you can ride it in your bedroom without waking your partner). Before you know it, the video is speaking to viewer pain points, “One of the challenges with boutique fitness is that it can be inconvenient.” They solution? Peloton.</p> \n<p>Thousands of classes, experienced instructors, community, and ease of use. Close-ups of the machine in use highlights certain features, but what this video demonstrates most is the experience you’ll have using Peloton. “This is what I’ve been missing,” says one video participant. I can’t help but think that’s the primary goal the makers of this video had for their viewers.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/nY5NvoZDKEQ\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>18. Zoom</h3> \n<p>This is a classic example of a product demo video. A solid, feature-heavy script immediately jumps into how professionals can use and benefit from Zoom. The viewer sees the product being used as they listen to how it works, and they’re left with a clear picture of what Zoom can offer them.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/VnyitUU4DUY\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>19. Gusto</h3> \n<p>I’ve saved the most comprehensive product demo video for last. This example, from HR software provider Gusto, clocks in at an impressive five minutes and fifty-six seconds.</p> \n<p>What follows is a careful walk-through of the product, it’s benefits, and how to pick the perfect plan.</p> \n<p>Viewers who make it to the end likely signal to Gusto that they’re ready to speak with a salesperson. This video probably works best for buyers further along in the buyer’s journey. If your goal is to introduce your product/service to new audiences, stick with a shorter option that’s quick and easy to consume.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"float: none; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\"> \n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/9lZsIKkZyM0\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h2>Using Product Demo Videos in Your Marketing Strategy</h2> \n<p>Product demo videos might take a bit of time and planning to create, but once they're live, they can be an effective piece of your brand's overall video marketing strategy.</p> \n<p>As 2020 continues, and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/millennials-vs-gen-z?hubs_signup-url=blog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhow-seo-varies-around-the-world&amp;hubs_signup-cta=null\">consumer seek out more video content</a> while researching products, marketers are also finding that <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing\">videos are their most effective asset</a>. Like them, you'll want to leverage video marketing and product demos to guide your prospect to the customer stage.</p> \n<p>Want to create your own video? Check out our <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/video-marketing?_ga=2.171224802.394907747.1559842484-112379962.1552485402\">ultimate guide to video marketing</a>.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's Note: This blog post was originally published in June 2019, but was updated for comprehensiveness and freshness in July 2020.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<div> \n <a class=\"close\">&nbsp;</a> \n</div> \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdemo-video&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 04 Aug 2020 23:00:00 +0000","feedId":924,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/demo-video.jpg#keepProtocol","linkMd5":"46d4450d184c5f539bcd7a5e8ef78ef3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn71@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-28-488_010d9dc64a2e0e09.webp","metaImg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/demo-video.jpg#keepProtocol","author":"Meg Prater","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdemo-video&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn87@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-28-629_eadc1b9f395c9e3e.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:26","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:26","title":"How Brands Like Google, Twitch, and Sephora Built Brand Communities — and How You Can, Too","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-brands-build-communities","description":"<p>Over the past few decades, companies, marketing departments, and c-suites have used the term \"community\" to refer to a smorgasbord of ideas, from wide-ranging organizational investments — such as neighborhood events or charity partnerships — to online forums and even simple email lists.</p> \n<p>These ideas aim to create some sense of the collective belonging people used to feel, long before our now-record isolation and loneliness. But most (and sometimes all) of these community-building measures are superficial, or even irrelevant, to what constitutes <em>real</em> community.</p> \n<p>We call the resulting so-called communities mirage communities: groups that organizations may label as communities, but that a trained eye can recognize are not.</p> \n<p>There are, however, a growing number of organizations that take the need for community far more seriously. These organizations invest in effective community principles, and they're rewarded with breakthrough innovation, critical feedback, brand loyalty, and employee retention.</p> \n<p>But these rewards don't appear magically. They require a special investment.</p> \n<p>So, how do some of today's most successful companies do it? Let's explore how Google, Twitch, and Sephora implement authentic community-building strategies, and how your own company can, too.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h3 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">1. Google invests in Labs.</h3> \n<p>At Google, community success comes in the form of collaborative groups, or what Google calls \"Labs.\"</p> \n<p>Each Google Lab brings together approximately 100 thought leaders, in specific industries, to tackle some of today's most pressing issues. Google Labs foster mutual respect and concern among members, which spawn conversations, collaborations, and opportunities that were never possible before. It's part of what keeps Google at the top of every \"most innovative\" company list today.</p> \n<p>For example, <a href=\"https://talksat.withgoogle.com/talk/the-food-lab\"><span>Google's Food Lab</span></a> focuses on the production, purchase, and presentation of food. Its members take on top food challenges, from \"How do we move our culture to a plant-forward diet?\" to \"How do we eliminate waste in our food system?\"</p> \n<p>In turn, Google is lauded as a brand that inspires the food industry, while it refines (and reduces) its own monstrous spending on healthy employee food perks — which, at one point, cost <a href=\"http://www.digitaljournal.com/article/253760\"><span>nearly $72 million a year</span></a> at the main office \"Googleplex\" alone.</p> \n<h3 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">2. Twitch succeeds with local groups.</h3> \n<p>Twitch attracts over <a href=\"https://twitchtracker.com/statistics\">2 million people per month</a> to watch and livestream digital video broadcasts. Their approach is built on a two-sided marketplace: they need to attract broadcasters, as well as audience members. Local community groups help them succeed.</p> \n<p>Twitch has built a worldwide team to support over <a href=\"https://help.twitch.tv/s/article/community-meetups-powered-by-twitch?language=en_US\"><span>40 local, city-based groups</span></a>, each of which hosts real-life and virtual events that foster genuine friendships and deep relationships between local Twitch members. However, local groups (and their leaders) must demonstrate how well they can bring members together, first.</p> \n<p>These local groups allow Twitch to transform online interactions — which can often feel transactional — into connections that have real meaning. Members return again and again to the brand, and recruit others to participate, because Twitch is a space where authentic emotional investments happen.</p> \n<h3 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">3. Sephora says \"yes\" to beauty enthusiasts.</h3> \n<p>Sephora — one of the largest beauty retailers in the world — has invested in building a <a href=\"https://www.sephora.com/community\"><span>makeup enthusiast community</span></a> that is both accessible on mobile devices and integrated <em>into</em> the shopping experience.</p> \n<p>Inside the community, members can discuss a variety of beauty products and methods, regardless of whether they're related to Sephora products or not. Within the community, Sephora enables members to follow interesting topics and connect with fellow members, keep up with trends and chat with brands, and score access to exclusive events.</p> \n<p>Community members can also gain access to beauty techniques and product information, engage with beauty company founders, and experience an affirming space with others who love the fun, play, and transformation of makeup.</p> \n<h3 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">What do these examples have in common?</h3> \n<p>Real communities are made up of relationships. Always. Relationships exist in the realm of personal experience, and although they may include transactions, they are never purely transactional. They also include some generosity — at least the kind where we help others without calculating the return on investment (ROI) for sending a card, answering a timely question, or holding a door open for a stranger coming in from the cold.</p> \n<blockquote> \n <p>To build an effective brand community, you must reject the premise that everything an organization does or offers must generate profit or exist within a transaction. Instead, community-building efforts will help consumers see more long-term value in your brand.</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p>People don't commit to, feel safe in, or extend themselves for relationships that only serve a person (or brand) \"getting\" something as cheaply and easily as possible. We commit to relationships in which we believe that others care about our success, too.</p> \n<p>In a real community, members help one another become who they want to be. This can include sharing information, skills, hard-won lessons, and — very often — attentive friendship. When a brand can offer this to members (e.g., customers, users, staff, colleagues, or volunteers), something much richer and more rewarding can develop.</p> \n<h3>Three Tips for Building True Community</h3> \n<ol> \n <li><strong> Go beyond the transaction. </strong>Make sure you go far beyond building transactional relationships. It's not enough to offer coupons or simply invite someone to a virtual or in-person event.</li> \n <li><strong> Define how you're helping members. </strong>Articulate exactly how you're enriching the lives of community members — help them, not just your corporate goals.</li> \n <li><strong> Think small. </strong>Community happens in small experiences. Intentionally create what we call \"campfire experiences,\" which are intimate experiences where participants have proximity, permission, and time to connect with a small group.</li> \n</ol> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhow-brands-build-communities&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 04 Aug 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":924,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/brand-community.jpg#keepProtocol","linkMd5":"b161efe1e457ea51ea572de7a41f5e68","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn27@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-27-406_e1bc477bf7f1ec8a.webp","metaImg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/brand-community.jpg#keepProtocol","author":"Charles Vogl and Carrie Melissa Jones","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhow-brands-build-communities&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx17/cdn44@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-28-599_a523a60997aa0333.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:25","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:25","title":"29 Free Resume Templates for Microsoft Word (& How to Make Your Own)","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/resume-templates-word","description":"<p>No matter what industry you work in (or your experience level in that industry), a plain, black-and-white resume written in Times New Roman font can actually weaken a job application.</p>  \n<p>But just because resumes have gotten more creative doesn’t mean you need special design software to make your application stand out. On the contrary, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-write-a-resume\">writing your resume</a> in good old Microsoft Word is still the perfect way to develop your personal brand, while also communicating your experience and career goals.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Read on to find out how to make your resume in word, then download one of these amazing resume templates that open directly in Microsoft Word.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Resume%20Template%201.jpg?width=1500&amp;name=Resume%20Template%201.jpg\" alt=\"free editable resume pdf template\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-resume-templates?hubs_post-cta=imagesir&amp;_ga=2.167404795.472723192.1596558721-1675356138.1572978608\"><em>Download a free, editable resume template. </em></a></p> \n<h3>1. Open Microsoft Word on your computer.</h3> \n<p>If you have Microsoft Word installed on your computer, open the program and let it load for a moment. There will be a couple of helpful options waiting for you on the first screen, specifically for resume creation.</p> \n<h3>2. Select either \"Basic Resume\" or \"Bold Resume\" from the template menu.</h3> \n<p>Once you've launched MS Word, a window of templates will appear. Scroll down until you see the template options designed for resumes -- there will be at least two of them. Double-click the one that suits your style and personal brand, but don't be too particular about design just yet ... you can customize these templates quite a bit.</p> \n<h3>3. Fill in your name and contact information at the top.</h3> \n<p>When your resume template opens, you'll see placeholder text for each line of your resume, starting with your first and last name at the top. Delete this header text and enter your name, as well as any contact information by which you want the recruiter to contact you.</p> \n<h3>4. Draft a brief summary of your experience and goals.</h3> \n<p>Use the first line below your name and contact info to describe who you are, what you do, and what you're looking for in your career.</p> \n<h3>5. Enter your school and latest education.</h3> \n<p>List any relevant degrees or certificates you received through schooling. You can safely exclude secondary education if you've graduated from an accredited college.</p> \n<h3>6. Describe each job you've held using the lines prompted on the template.</h3> \n<p>Your professional experience is frequently the most important section of your resume, so feel free to rank this section <em>above</em> your skills and education, depending on how many jobs you previously held.</p> \n<h3>7. List all relevant skills.</h3> \n<p>If you have experience in certain software, exercises, problem-solving, or management techniques, use them to populate your skills. Your resume's \"Skills\" section helps reveal what all of your previous jobs or related experiences have in common, based on what they taught you and what you provided them.</p> \n<h3>8. Describe any relevant accolades and accomplishments.</h3> \n<p>Finish out your resume with any personal accomplishments or accolades you think a hiring manager in your industry would appreciate. Although this section shouldn't include a <em>Most Improved</em> recognition from little league, for example, it should definitely include your <em>Marketer of the Month</em> award from your last position.</p> \n<h2><span>Free Resume Templates That Download in Word</span></h2> \n<p>Of course, if you’re already employed full-time, it’s hard to find the time to apply to a new job opportunity, let alone update your resume to reflect your qualifications. Luckily, there are numerous publishers out there who've created incredible resume templates for quick editing and formatting in Word.</p> \n<p>To keep you from hunting the internet for the resume templates that are both free and compatible with MS Word, we’ve listed 19 more options below for you to customize with your own information right now. Some of them come with variations so you can pick your favorite design. Four of them cater specifically to marketers.</p> \n<p>They’re so nice, you won’t believe they open up in Microsoft Word once you download them.</p> \n<h3>1. Monogram Header Resume Template</h3> \n<p>We'll start with a simple one. This is a HubSpot exclusive resume template that is simple and clean with attractive monogrammed headers to call out each section of the resume. The rest of the design relies on a simple serif font for easy reading, which is a good thing considering that hiring managers only take <a href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90263970/your-resume-only-gets-7-4-seconds-to-make-an-impression-heres-how-to-stand-out\">7.4 seconds</a> to evaluate a resume. You want your experience section to be easily scannable.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/53/blog-files/Monogram%20Header%20Resume%20Template.docx\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/53/blog-files/Monogram%20Header%20Resume%20Template.docx\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Monogram%20Header%20Resume.png?width=450&amp;name=Monogram%20Header%20Resume.png\" alt=\"Monogram Header Resume\" width=\"450\" style=\"width: 450px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></a></p> \n<h3>2. Maroon Sidebar Resume Template</h3> \n<p>Pulling your more text-heavy information off to the side in an attractive color-blocked sidebar, this resume lets your experience stand for itself in white space at the top. It's also easily customizable with no difficult-to-manipulate tables or formatting. The sidebars are in movable text boxes that can even be removed if you wish.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/53/blog-files/Maroon%20Sidebar%20Resume%20Template.docx\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/53/blog-files/Maroon%20Sidebar%20Resume%20Template.docx\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Maroon%20Sidebar%20Resume.png?width=451&amp;name=Maroon%20Sidebar%20Resume.png\" alt=\"Maroon Sidebar Resume\" width=\"451\" style=\"width: 451px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></a></p> \n<h3>3. Centered Bar Resume Template</h3> \n<p>This resume takes on a different look than most resumes, centered around a single bar. This makes the resume more visually striking, which could draw attention as hiring managers are evaluating candidates. It also puts emphasis on the objective with your chronological experience supporting it underneath. All of this is in an attractive serif font that is elegant and classy.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/53/blog-files/Centered%20Bar%20Resume%20Template.docx\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/53/blog-files/Centered%20Bar%20Resume%20Template.docx\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Centered%20Bar%20Resume.png?width=451&amp;name=Centered%20Bar%20Resume.png\" alt=\"Centered Bar Resume\" width=\"451\" style=\"width: 451px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></a></p> \n<h3>4. It's perfect for individuals who are looking for more organic color than the ones more typically found in resumes, and the colors are also easily changed in Microsoft Word's theme settings. It also includes a skill-level bar, adding a nice visual touch to the template.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/53/blog-files/Bold%20Serif%20Resume%20Template.docx\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/53/blog-files/Bold%20Serif%20Resume%20Template.docx\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Bold%20Serif%20Resume.png?width=415&amp;name=Bold%20Serif%20Resume.png\" alt=\"Bold Serif Resume\" width=\"415\" style=\"width: 415px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></a></p> \n<h3>5. The warm-colored panel on the right-hand side is pre-formatted for a written profile, where you can write a summary of your background or a form letter to each employer.</p> \n<p>Just be sure to personalize this messaging to each new recipient so it works for the job you’re applying to. This template is available on Freesumes, and is free to users once they share the page to Facebook or Twitter.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.freesumes.com/free-creative-resume-design-smart-professional/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/smart%20and%20professional%20resume%20template-1.jpg?width=1500&amp;name=smart%20and%20professional%20resume%20template-1.jpg\" alt=\"Smart and Professional resume template for MS Word\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<h3>16. Spick and Span Resume Template</h3> \n<p>There isn't a better name for the template below. The Spick and Span resume might be the cleanest-looking sheet on this list.</p> \n<p>It uses boldface, all-caps, and gray typeface to structure various headers of the document differently and maximize the hiring manager's reading experience. And all that minimalism makes the professional headshot at the top pop off the page.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.freesumes.com/spick-span-clean-resume-template-freebie/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/spick-and-span-resume-template.png?width=1500&amp;name=spick-and-span-resume-template.png\" alt=\"Spick and Span resume template with clean, bold typeface and professional headshot\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<h3>17. Timeline-Style Resume Template</h3> \n<p>Similar to the Centered Bar resume earlier in the post, Hloom’s Timeline template is a super simple but creative way to tell your story.</p> \n<p>You can convey your progression through various jobs you’ve held on one side of the vertical line, and more static elements of your background — such as skills and education — on the other.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.hloom.com/get/timeline/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/timeline-style%20resume%20template-2.png?width=1500&amp;name=timeline-style%20resume%20template-2.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"Timeline-style resume template for MS Word\"></p> \n<h3>18. Content Production Resume Template</h3> \n<p>This basic resume template is suited for content producers at all stages in their career. By spreading out the header and \"Skills\" text horizontally, the resume below fits a lot of crucial information comfortably on one page (of course, it also comes with a second page if you need it).</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/marketing-resume-templates\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/content-production-resume-template.png?width=1500&amp;name=content-production-resume-template.png\" alt=\"Content production resume template\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<h3>19. Fresh Resume Template</h3> \n<p>This is perhaps the most imaginative of all the Word-based resume templates on this list — with both a skills meter and a comic headshot.</p> \n<p>The template was designed by <a href=\"https://www.behance.net/venkatanaresh\">Venkata Naresh</a> and comes with 12 different versions of the design you see below. Have you created a <a href=\"https://www.bitmoji.com/\">Bitmoji</a> of yourself? Do you think your employer would find it creative? CV Resume Template</h3> \n<p>The curriculum vitae-style resume below flips the typical two-column resume so the basic applicant information is listed across the right side, rather than the left.</p> \n<p>Feel free to change the color of this sidebar in Microsoft Word if dark-red isn't your thing — the template can pull off any color you wish.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.freesumes.com/unconventional-cv-template-giveaway-avant-garde/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/cv-resume-template.png?width=1500&amp;name=cv-resume-template.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"Reverse two-column resume template in CV style with red sidebar\"></p> \n<h3>21. Goldenrod Resume Template</h3> \n<p>This template, also offered on Freesumes, dares to use yellow as the dominant color — but doesn’t sacrifice professionalism in the process.</p> \n<p>The document anchors the education section to a thick, bright banner across the bottom, but you can likely change this to a skills section with some simple editing in Microsoft Word.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.freesumes.com/goldenrod-yellow-a-free-clean-word-resume-template/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/goldenrod%20resume%20template-1.jpg?width=1500&amp;name=goldenrod%20resume%20template-1.jpg\" alt=\"Goldenrod yellow resume template for MS Word\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<h3>22. Resume Template With Personal Endorsements</h3> \n<p>This resume template has quite a flashy header — no photography pun intended — but it’s not just for photographers. What makes this resume unique is the space for references on the lower right-hand side.</p> \n<p>Does your field need others to vouch for your experience? This resume gives you room for three solid recommendations.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.hloom.com/get/personal+endorsements/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/resume%20template%20with%20personal%20endorsements-2.png?width=1500&amp;name=resume%20template%20with%20personal%20endorsements-2.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"Photographer's resume template for MS Word with space for recommendations and endorsements\"></p> \n<h3>23. Creative Resume Template</h3> \n<p>This one was designed by the stationery experts at MOO and is offered for download by Microsoft. Simple but vibrant, this template hugs the text with an artistic header and footer — great for recent graduates who need to fill empty space on the page.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://templates.office.com/en-us/Creative-resume-designed-by-MOO-TM16392718\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/creative%20resume%20template-1.png?width=1500&amp;name=creative%20resume%20template-1.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"Resume template for MS Word with header and footer design\"></p> \n<h3>24. Modern Resume Template</h3> \n<p>This resume embraces simplicity with a slight touch of color to make things a bit more interesting. It also nicely sections off Skills and Education notes from the Work History list.</p> \n<p>With LiveCareer.com, you can generate a template with your basic information and then download it to add small details.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.livecareer.com/build-resume/section/cntc?templateflow=contact&amp;skin=MLT6&amp;theme=%2339c3b1\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.05.44%20PM.jpg?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.05.44%20PM.jpg\" alt=\"Modern Resume Template\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<h3>25. Functional Resume Template</h3> \n<p>This NovoResume.com template is colorful and includes a place for your headshot which could make you look both interesting and confident to an employer.</p> \n<p>A colorful format like this might be great for someone in the media or advertising industry that wants to keep their job application visually memorable to prospective employers.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://novoresume.com/editor/new-resume-preview/1?pageAuthDesired=/editor/new-resume/1\">here</a>.</h4> \n<h3><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/functional-resume-template.jpg?width=1500&amp;name=functional-resume-template.jpg\" alt=\"functional resume template\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">26. Elegant Resume Template</h3> \n<p>If you're looking for simplicity and efficiency rather than something colorful, consider this Elegant Resume Template from Jofibo.</p> \n<p>With Jofibo, you can select this or other similar templates on the website, enter your information, and then download it quickly and easily.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://jofibo.com/resume-templates/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<h3><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.23.03%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.23.03%20PM.png\" alt=\"elegant resume template\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">27. Blue Corporate HR Resume Template</h3> \n<p>Canva, an easy-to-use design template website, offers a few great resume templates. One of them is this simple resume with a touch of color in the background.</p> \n<p>Because of the color and image, it's pretty memorable. But, for those who prefer a more conservative resume look, this template is fairly simple.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://www.canva.com/templates/MADftnj-Tj4-blue-corporate-hr-professional-resume/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<h3><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/canva-blue-corporate-hr-professional-resume-MADftnj-Tj4%20(1).jpg?width=1500&amp;name=canva-blue-corporate-hr-professional-resume-MADftnj-Tj4%20(1).jpg\" alt=\"corporate hr professional resume\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">28. Concept Resume</h3> \n<p>This resume is great for people in the technical space because it adds a touch of color and feels more compact, which will force you to get right to the point about your key skills, certifications, and work experiences.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download this template <a href=\"https://resumelab.com/resume-templates\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.36.46%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.36.46%20PM.png\" alt=\"Concept Resume Template\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<h3>29. Cream and Green Account Executive Resume Template</h3> \n<p>This resume is also downloadable and editable on Canva. It was created for account executives but could also be great for graphic designers or people working in visual fields due to its unique, but still professional, color scheme.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">Download or edit the resume template <a href=\"https://www.canva.com/templates/MADk-BomAYs-cream-and-green-flat-design-account-executive-business-commercial-resume/\">here</a>.</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://marketplace.canva.com/MADk-BomAYs/1/0/thumbnail_large/canva-cream-and-green-flat-design-account-executive-business-commercial-resume-MADk-BomAYs.jpg\" alt=\"Cream and Green Account Executive Resume Template\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<h2>How to Save Your Resume</h2> \n<p>Remember, once you’ve finished personalizing your resume, you’re not ready to submit an application yet. To ensure your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-format-resume\">resume’s format</a> stays the same for everyone who receives it, save the document as a PDF. Best case scenario? Even the hiring manager won’t believe your resume came from Word.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's Note: This post was originally published in 2018 but was updated in May 2020 for comprehensiveness.</em></p>
