erx/cdn43@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-30-544_bf3200b6fc6ef01a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/urban%20development%20resume%20template-1.png?width=1500&name=urban%20development%20resume%20template-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn95@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-31-834_1759de5996d31187.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/email-marketing-resume-template.png?width=1500&name=email-marketing-resume-template.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn31@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-38-064_eb0964edabc71e0d.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/info%20pop%20resume%20template-1.png?width=1500&name=info%20pop%20resume%20template-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn72@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-33-409_daa8c8a0b1a3b19f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/dark-resume-template.png?width=1500&name=dark-resume-template.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx20/cdn87@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-31-691_c40121f344a956df.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/neat%20and%20confident%20resume%20template-1.jpg?width=1500&name=neat%20and%20confident%20resume%20template-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx17/cdn76@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-39-567_4060a26c3549e685.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/inbound-marketing-intern-resume-template.png?width=1500&name=inbound-marketing-intern-resume-template.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn4@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-31-927_e841f2b012ea657b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/smart%20and%20professional%20resume%20template-1.jpg?width=1500&name=smart%20and%20professional%20resume%20template-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx17/cdn20@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-38-151_eb14c3923098b3a1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/spick-and-span-resume-template.png?width=1500&name=spick-and-span-resume-template.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn3@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-34-581_576e040da2353def.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/timeline-style%20resume%20template-2.png?width=1500&name=timeline-style%20resume%20template-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-28-894_3ab21d73b542bf90.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/content-production-resume-template.png?width=1500&name=content-production-resume-template.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn44@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-35-656_aac3f82ddc64cb44.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/fresh%20resume%20template-1.jpg?width=1500&name=fresh%20resume%20template-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn96@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-38-745_7903defd235cdab5.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/cv-resume-template.png?width=1500&name=cv-resume-template.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn67@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-28-853_7f07d1c6a2597391.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/goldenrod%20resume%20template-1.jpg?width=1500&name=goldenrod%20resume%20template-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn59@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-28-755_4a85062db6e2a3f3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/resume%20template%20with%20personal%20endorsements-2.png?width=1500&name=resume%20template%20with%20personal%20endorsements-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn7@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-32-765_b47a2aaf3799e34b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/creative%20resume%20template-1.png?width=1500&name=creative%20resume%20template-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn52@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-35-810_de7229997867d69b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.05.44%20PM.jpg?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.05.44%20PM.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn28@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-29-506_26ea69494ef56ddf.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/functional-resume-template.jpg?width=1500&name=functional-resume-template.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn60@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-29-790_483d01add479399d.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.23.03%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.23.03%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn24@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-37-171_161039b66ec52570.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/canva-blue-corporate-hr-professional-resume-MADftnj-Tj4%20(1).jpg?width=1500&name=canva-blue-corporate-hr-professional-resume-MADftnj-Tj4%20(1).jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn44@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-33-864_3f87d6e726baab39.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.36.46%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202019-10-03%20at%202.36.46%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx17/cdn92@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-36-049_0cda40a753b3b283.webp","https://marketplace.canva.com/MADk-BomAYs/1/0/thumbnail_large/canva-cream-and-green-flat-design-account-executive-business-commercial-resume-MADk-BomAYs.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn47@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-29-627_a79f97f999f2e046.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fresume-templates-word&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn27@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-35-485_89f0657ea58a2f78.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:26","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:26","title":"How to Plan Your Instagram Posts [+ Free Instagram Planning Templates]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/plan-instagram-posts","description":"<p>When you're not following a plan on social media, it's easy to forget to post regularly.</p>   \n<p>Additionally, creating image and video-based content that's meant to drive revenue for your business can seem <em>far</em> away from your bottom line.</p> \n<p>However, nowadays, <a href=\"https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/53/Mention/hubspotxmention_ebook_instagram-engagement-report.pdf\">71% of businesses are on the platform</a> — to compete with other companies in your industry, then, it's critical you have a solid Instagram strategy in-place, particularly if your intended audience uses the app.</p> \n<p>Fortunately, once you have an ideal plan for your Instagram content, you're able to create content more intentionally and ultimately drive more results for your team and your organization.</p> \n<p>In this post, we'll cover everything from determining what kind of content you want to post, to picking a content theme. Then, we'll get into the details of planning individual posts.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Instagram%20Post%20Template,%20Blog%20Image.jpg?width=1500&amp;name=Instagram%20Post%20Template,%20Blog%20Image.jpg\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"free editable Instagram Post Template\">HubSpot, AdobeSpark, and Iconosquare teamed up to create a 30-day planning guide for business Instagram planning.</p> \n<p>We've also thrown in <strong>30 templates</strong> to help you get started. <strong><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/30-days-of-instagram?hubs_post-cta=body\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Click here to get the planning guide</span></a>.</strong></p> \n<h2><strong>Type of Content to Post on Instagram</strong></h2> \n<p>Regardless of which kind of content you decide to post, it should always be content that attracts your ideal audience. Think beyond your product, service, or office — what does your ideal customer <em>actually</em> care about, and what motivates them to follow a business account on Instagram?</p> \n<p>If you know your audience is interested in consuming bite-sized education on social media, you might use Instagram to share industry tips and tricks. Videos or well-organized captions can be useful vehicles for providing your audience with well-researched information for their benefit, rather than the benefit of your business.</p> \n<p>If your product or service lends itself to being photographed, consider sharing photos or videos of real customers using it. You can lighten your own content creation load by relying on user-generated content, too. Have your customers send in photos of your product in-action.</p> \n<p>Here's an example of how Beats by Dre uses Instagram to showcase customers using their products:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-21%20at%2011.21.10%20AM.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019-10-21 at 11.21.10 AM\">\n</div> \n<div style=\"font-size: 11px;\">\n <em><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B2mxwjRl8QS/\">Image Source</a></em>\n</div> \n<p>Still, there's no need to make these product or service posts promotional. Instead, the value for your Instagram following would come from drawing personal connections with real stories about how others have successfully used your product.</p> \n<p>However, if your audience isn't consuming education on Instagram and your product or service isn't easily photographed, you can take a more aesthetically-focused route, posting images and videos that people would simply love to consume. These may not drive a significant number of conversions, but a visual-first Instagram can amass a large amount of followers.</p> \n<p>The key with the aesthetically-pleasing route is to check in frequently to make sure your posts are driving actual value (perhaps in the form of brand awareness or community among your followers) for your business.</p> \n<p>If you're unsure of the type of content you want to post or the kind of content that will succeed for your brand, pick the one that you believe your audience will be most interested in seeing — product-agnostic education, product-centric and usage-focused content, or aesthetically pleasing content — and try it consistently for a month.</p> \n<p>Then, try another type for the following month and compare engagement rates. How many people are liking and commenting on your content? How many followers did you gain each month? What other business outcomes, if any, were impacted by your Instagram posts?</p> \n<p>In addition to deciding the general topics you'll post on Instagram, you'll want to experiment and decide on which content <em>formats</em> you'll post. For example, if you take an educational approach, experiment with videos versus text-focused images, and various lengths of captions.</p> \n<p>Alternatively, if your educational content lives on your blog, knowledge base, or in another library, consider using Instagram posts to point people to those resources rather than squeezing too much information into one Instagram.</p> \n<p>For example, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/hubspotacademy/\">HubSpot Academy's Instagram</a> often promotes in-depth courses that HubSpot Academy produces rather than trying to dive into the details in the caption, image, or video itself. The account keeps followers interested by sharing short clips and tips from the courses, too:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Instagram%20Planning-3.png?width=429&amp;name=Instagram%20Planning-3.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"429\" style=\"width: 429px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\">\n</div> \n<p>Additionally, we've put together this downloadable calendar of creative content ideas if you're not sure what type of content to try first.</p> \n<h2><strong>Your Instagram's Visual Theme</strong></h2> \n<p>Once you've decided on the type of content you want to post, you'll want to select a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-themes\">visual theme for your posts</a>.</p> \n<p>Aesthetic consistency will help you in several ways:</p> \n<ol> \n <li>When an Instagram user finds your business's account, the images will appear coordinated and well-thought-out.</li> \n <li>Your followers will begin to sense pattern in your content and pause when they see your post as they scroll because they recognize that pattern.</li> \n <li>When you've pre-selected a go-to font and color scheme, it takes some of the planning pressure off of you. There are fewer decisions to make for each new post.</li> \n</ol> \n<p>If you use Adobe Spark, you can download our free Adobe Spark Instagram templates to get started on creating a new post with a template rather than starting from scratch. You'll also get access to the previously-mentioned calendar of content ideas.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>To establish visual consistency across your posts, pay attention to the colors in your photos, the filters you use, the fonts you use in your images, and, if you'd like, the pattern of content types you're posting.</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Colors</strong>: Keep your brand colors top-of-mind when creating Instagram posts. Pick a few colors that complement your primary brand color and ensure that the most prominent color in each of your posts is one of those colors.</li> \n <li><strong>Filters</strong>: When using filters, do so lightly, as over-editing can dilute the quality of your photos. If you decide to use filters, use the same one or two across all posts.</li> \n <li><strong>Fonts</strong>: Select one font to use whenever you want to overlay text on photos or videos. Since Instagram is a friendly platform, aim to use an easy-to-read, sans-serif font and keep it the same across all posts. Use the same couple of font colors, too.</li> \n <li><strong>Content Pattern</strong>: To create a visual pattern for your overall feed, make sure that every third post has a certain background color. Since Instagram has three columns in the grid view, you'll end up with a column that shows you thoughtfully plan your posts. You might consider using a white background with the same font style and color to share an industry tip for every third post, for example.</li> \n</ul> \n<h2><strong>Tools for Making the Most of Your Instagram</strong></h2> \n<p>In order to stay organized, we recommend using two types of tools — a post scheduling tool, and a tool that allows you to link to several different places from your Instagram bio.</p> \n<p>By using a post scheduling tool, you'll be able to plan out as far in advance as you'd like, ensuring you have a steady stream of content ready to be posted even when other projects pop up in your day-to-day work. Posting consistently is important for follower retention and will give you more opportunities to experiment and figure out which posts get the most engagement.</p> \n<p>Scheduling your posts also allows you to visualize which types of posts you have coming out and swap posts if need be. You can see the weeks for which you've planned enough content and those during which there are still empty slots.</p> \n<p>You can also use a spreadsheet like this one (<a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-content-calendar?hubs_post-cta=body\">download for free here</a>):</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Instagram%20Planning-1.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 20px; text-align: center;\"><strong><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-content-calendar?hubs_post-cta=body\">Download the Calendar</a></em></strong></p> \n<p><strong>Examples of post scheduling tools</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/social-inbox\">HubSpot Social Tools</a>, Later, Buffer, Hopper</p> \n<p>Since Instagram only allows you to place one hyperlink in your bio at the top of your profile, we also recommend investing a few dollars per month in a tool that lets you create one landing page that links out to several other pages.</p> \n<p>Then, in individual posts, you can reference clickable links available at the link in your bio, which provides a much more user-friendly experience than having your followers copy a URL manually into their browser, toggling between apps.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Instagram%20Planning.png\" alt=\"\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p><strong>Examples of post scheduling tools</strong>: Linktree, Lnk.Bio, Link In Profile</p> \n<h2><strong>Planning Process</strong></h2> \n<p>Once you've decided on the content type and visual theme that you'll use on your brand's Instagram account, it's time to start planning posts.</p> \n<p>Create a spreadsheet with the following columns (or download our free, pre-made spreadsheet along with planning templates for all of your other social media channels, too):</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Date of publication</strong></li> \n <li><strong>Time of publication</strong></li> \n <li><strong>Image caption</strong></li> \n <li><strong>Image file name or a link</strong> (if it has been uploaded to the web)</li> \n <li><strong>The link that you'll add to your bio</strong> when the post goes live (or add to a Linktree-type multiple links tool)</li> \n <li><strong>Campaign/Goal</strong>: What is the goal for this post? Are you trying to amass more followers? Drive sign-ups for your product, a free trial, a consultation, or another next step toward becoming a customer? Whatever it is, an articulated goal will help you make sure that each post exists for a purpose — you won't be creating a dead end for your followers, but rather an opportunity for continued engagement with your account, brand, or product.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>When you're done, it should look like this:</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Instagram%20Planning-2.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 20px;\"><strong><em><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-content-calendar?hubs_post-cta=body\">Download This Template</a></em></strong></p> \n<p>A hint — duplicate the spreadsheet tab for Instagram <em>Stories, </em>as well, to leverage Instagram's other avenue for engaging with your followers. Stories are best used for interactive content like polls and quizzes, sharing lots of photos or videos from live events, and more casual, friendly updates.</p> \n<p>Once you have your spreadsheet ready to go, decide on your frequency. We recommend ramping up to posting around three times per week.</p> \n<p>Post at least once a week to establish a reliable posting pattern for your followers. You'll risk losing followers if people feel that they're not consistently seeing interesting or helpful content from your account.</p> \n<p>To ensure you establish that consistent pattern, set dates and times for posting first. For example, if you decide to post every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, fill in the date and time column with the next month's Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.</p> \n<p>Then, add a recurring event to your calendar for post planning for the following two to four weeks. Set a recurring, 10-minute calendar invitation at your selected posting times to reference your spreadsheet and quickly post whatever you've planned if you're not using an automated scheduling tool. With the planning sheet handy, you'll be able to simply copy and paste captions and links, and you can then locate the image easily.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>When slotting specific posts into your spreadsheet, begin in whichever column you'd like. You could start by evenly splitting the rows into separate campaigns and then filling in the caption or image link for each post later.</p> \n<p>If you already have a repository of photos that you can post, though, you might start pasting the links into the Image File Name/Link column and fill in the other columns afterward.</p> \n<p>You'll also want to start creating more visual content for future posts. Consider repurposing event images that your company has taken, soliciting photos of your employees or customers using your product, or simply creating visually-appealing text graphics like <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B2Er48Aghza/\">this one</a> on a tool like Canva or Photoshop.</p> \n<p>Upload each photo to a centralized folder and make use of a standardized naming convention so that it's easy to find the file you're looking for. If you're not using a post scheduling tool, you'll likely have to post directly from your phone.</p> \n<p>To easily access photos with their file names from your phone, you can upload photos to a <a href=\"https://www.google.com/photos/about/\">Google Photos album</a> on your computer and then use the Google Photos app on your phone to directly download the content prior to posting.</p> \n<p>Finally, decide on your caption for each post. The ideal caption style depends on your audience and the type of content you're sharing. For example, aesthetics-focused content may perform best with a quirky, short, and clever caption, while education-focused content may be most likely shared and liked if the caption includes a couple of concise, clear tips.</p> \n<p>Make sure to include <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-hashtags\">three to five thoughtfully planned hashtags in your caption</a> or in a comment on your own post to ensure it gets in front of new audiences. You'll want to include a mix of branded hashtags (eg. #HubSpotAcademy or #OnlineLearning) and trending hashtags so that your post is seen by more people.</p> \n<p>You can research the hashtags you might want to use by typing them into Instagram (head to the 'Search' tab and then tap 'Tags') to see how much volume they get. Prioritize the higher-volume ones.</p> \n<p>By taking a thoughtful approach to planning your Instagram content, you can ensure that your posts deliver value to your followers, convert those followers into leads or product users, and expand the reach of your brand's messaging to new audiences.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in October, 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<div>\n <a class=\"close\"> </a>\n</div>  \n<img Alexander","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Instagram%20Post%20Template,%20Blog%20Image.jpg?width=1500&name=Instagram%20Post%20Template,%20Blog%20Image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn63@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-39-031_f7fbb6522b593b17.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-10-21%20at%2011.21.10%20AM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn87@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-37-681_8ae6ffd193ef87db.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Instagram%20Planning-3.png?width=429&name=Instagram%20Planning-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn28@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-39-457_bf8e0adae702f136.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Instagram%20Planning-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn4@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-39-602_1271e64d0a975c8f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Instagram%20Planning.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn55@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-28-565_5fd4375feab1f933.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Instagram%20Planning-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn80@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-38-510_e03718c6ff622eae.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fplan-instagram-posts&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn40@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-31-003_a79d49b27db9ba05.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:26","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:26","title":"11 Sample Business Plans to Help You Write Your Own","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/sample-business-plans","description":"<p>Ask any successful sports coach how they win so many games, and they’ll tell you they have a unique plan for every single game they coach. To have a fighting chance against any of their opponents, they need to prepare a specific game plan tailored to each of their opponents’ strengths and weaknesses. Otherwise, they’ll get crushed.</p>  \n<p>The same logic applies to business. If you want to build a thriving company that can pull ahead of the competition, you need to prepare yourself for battle before you break into a market. Because companies who can find gaps in your business model will quickly learn how to fill those gaps and solve your customers’ problems better than you can.</p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 18px;\">The business world moves fast, and it’s full of ambitious companies scrambling to gain the majority of their industry’s market share. So how do you keep up? Writing a viable business plan and following it religiously is one of the most important first steps.</p> \n<p>Business plans guide you along the rocky journey of growing a company. Referencing one throughout your voyage will keep you on the path toward success. And if your business plan is compelling enough, it can also convince investors to give you funding.</p> \n<p>But how do you actually write a viable and convincing business plan?</p> \n<p>Below, let's review the format of a business plan and sample business plans you can use to inspire your own.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>Business Plan Format</h2> \n<p>Before you get started on your business plan, you might be wondering, <em>\"Where do I start? How should I format this?\"</em></p> \n<p>Typically, a business plan is a document that will detail how a company will achieve its goals.</p> \n<p>Most business plans include the following sections:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Executive summary: This section will include an overview of the company, your unique value proposition, and a team overview.</li> \n <li>Market opportunity: This is where you'll detail the opportunity in the market. Where is the gap in the current industry and how will your product fill that gap?</li> \n <li>Key features and benefits: At some point in your business plan, you'll review the key features and benefits of your products and/or services.</li> \n <li>Pricing and revenue: This is where you'll discuss your cost structure and various revenue streams.</li> \n <li>Target audience: This section will describe who your customer segments are in detail. What is the demographic and psychographic information of your audience?</li> \n <li>Marketing strategy: Here, you'll discuss how you'll acquire new customers with your marketing strategy.</li> \n <li>Competitive landscape: This is where you'll detail who the top competitors are.</li> \n <li>Financials: This is where you'll detail the funding that's required and discuss investment opportunities.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>While some business plans might include more or less information, these are the key details you'll want to include.</p> \n<p>Keep in mind, that each of these sections will be formatted differently. Some may be in paragraph format, while others will be in charts.</p> \n<p>Now that you know what's included and how to format a business plan, let's review some templates.</p> \n<h2>Sample Business Plan Templates</h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/business-templates/one-page-business-plan?hubs_post-cta=imagesir\">HubSpot's One-Page Business Plan</a></h3> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/One-Page%20Business%20Plan%20Template.jpg?width=1500&amp;name=One-Page%20Business%20Plan%20Template.jpg\" alt=\"ffree editable one-page business plan pdf template\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/business-plan-template?hubs_post-cta=imagesir\"><em>Download a free, editable one-page business plan template.&nbsp;</em></a></p> \n<p>The business plan linked above was created here at HubSpot, and is perfect for businesses of any size -- no matter how much strategy they still have to develop.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Including fields such as Company Description, Required Funding, and Implementation Timeline, this one-page business plan&nbsp;gives businesses a framework for how to build their brand and what tasks to keep track of as they grow. Then, as the business matures, it can expand on its original business plan with a new iteration of the above document.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/business-plan-template?hubs_post-cta=body\">HubSpot's Downloadable Business Plan Template</a></h3> \n<p>We created&nbsp;a <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/business-plan-template?_ga=2.127437454.286928102.1577976255-1307414301.1541080541\">business plan template</a> for entrepreneurs.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-08-07%20at%204.02.33%20PM.png?width=1500&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-08-07%20at%204.02.33%20PM.png\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"hubspot free editable business plan pdf template\"></p> \n<h6 style=\"text-align: center; font-weight: normal;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/business-plan-template?hubs_post-cta=imagesir\"><em>Download a free, editable one-</em><em>page</em><em> business plan template.&nbsp;</em></a></h6> \n<p>The template is designed as a guide and checklist for starting your own business, so you’ll learn what to include in each section of your business plan and how to do it. There’s also a list for you to check off when you finish each section of your business plan.</p> \n<p>Strong game plans help coaches win games and help businesses rocket to the top of their industries. So if you dedicate the time and effort required to write a viable and convincing business plan, you’ll boost your chances of success and even dominance in your market.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.thoughtco.com/sample-business-plan-4083327\">ThoughtCo’s Sample Business Plan </a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/thoughtco-sample-business-plan.jpg?width=393&amp;name=thoughtco-sample-business-plan.jpg\" alt=\"Fictional business plan by ThoughtCo.\" width=\"393\" style=\"width: 393px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>If you want to reference an actual business plan while writing your own, ThoughtCo’s got you covered. They created a fictional company called Acme Management Technology and wrote an entire business plan for them.</p> \n<p>Using their sample business plan as a guide while filling out your own will help you catch and include small yet important details in your business plan that you otherwise might not have noticed.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.bplans.com/downloads/business-plan-template/\">BPlan’s Free Business Plan Template</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/bp-plans-business-template.jpg?width=364&amp;name=bp-plans-business-template.jpg\" alt=\"BPlan's free business plan template.\" width=\"364\" style=\"width: 364px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>One of the more financially oriented sample business plans in this list, BPlan’s free business plan template dedicates many of its pages to your business’ financial plan and financial statements.</p> \n<p>After filling this business plan out, your company will truly understand its financial health and the steps you need to take to maintain or improve it.</p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://hbr.org/1985/05/how-to-write-a-winning-business-plan\">Harvard Business Review’s “How to Write a Winning Business Plan”</a></h3> \n<p>Most sample business plans teach you what to include in your business plan, but this Harvard Business Review article will take your business plan to the next level -- it teaches you the why and how behind writing a business plan.</p> \n<p>With the guidance of Stanley Rich and Richard Gumpert, co-authors of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Business-Plans-That-Win-Enterprise/dp/0060913916\">Business Plans That Win: Lessons From the MIT Enterprise Forum</a>, you'll learn how to write a convincing business plan that emphasizes the market demand for your product or service and the financial benefits investors can reap from putting money into your venture, rather than trying to sell them on how great your product or service is.</p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/how-to-start-a-business\">HubSpot’s Complete Guide to Starting a Business</a></h3> \n<p>If you’re an entrepreneur, you know writing a business plan is one of the most challenging first steps to starting a business. Fortunately, with HubSpot's comprehensive guide to starting a business, you'll learn how to map out all the details of your business by understanding what to include in your business plan and why it’s important to include them. The guide also fleshes out an entire sample business plan for you.</p> \n<p>If you need further guidance on starting a business, HubSpot's guide can teach you how to make your business legal, choose and register your business name, fund your business, gives information about small business tax, and provides marketing, sales, and service tips.</p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://www.pandadoc.com/free-business-plan-template/\">Panda Doc’s Free Business Plan Template</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/panda-doc-sample-business-plan.jpg?width=449&amp;name=panda-doc-sample-business-plan.jpg\" alt=\"Panda Doc free business plan template.\" width=\"449\" style=\"width: 449px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>Panda Doc’s free business plan template is one of the more detailed and fleshed out sample business plans on this list. It describes what you should include in each of its sections, so you don't have to come up with everything from scratch.</p> \n<p>Once you fill it out, you’ll fully understand your business’ nitty gritty details and how all of its moving parts should work together to contribute to your business’ success.</p> \n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://www.sba.gov/business-guide/plan-your-business/write-your-business-plan\">Small Business Administration Free Business Plan Template</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/small-business-administration-sample-business-plan.jpg?width=600&amp;name=small-business-administration-sample-business-plan.jpg\" alt=\"Small Business Administration sample business plan.\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>The Small Business Administration offers several free business plan templates that can be used to inspire your own plan. Before you get started, you can decide what type of business plan you need -- a traditional or lean start-up plan.</p> \n<p>Then, you can review the format for both of those plans and view examples of what they might look like.</p> \n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B7MRp5D7h2-YRC1aeDA1MEpxd2M/view\">Culina Sample Business Plan</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/culina-business-plan-template.jpg?width=381&amp;name=culina-business-plan-template.jpg\" alt=\"Culina sample business plan template.\" width=\"381\" style=\"width: 381px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>Culina's sample business plan is a great template to use if you just want to fill in your information. You can also use this template as a guide while you're gathering important details. After looking at this sample, you'll have a better understanding of the data and research you need to do for your own business plan.</p> \n<h3>10. <a href=\"https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByPuznSKHuX_NFBiZGxSNW45MDA/view\">Plum Sample Business Plan</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/plum-sample-business-plan.jpg?width=369&amp;name=plum-sample-business-plan.jpg\" alt=\"Plum sample business plan.\" width=\"369\" style=\"width: 369px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>This is one of my favorite sample business plans, because you can see how implementing visuals can help tell the story of your brand. The images in this template are cutting edge, which makes sense for an innovative company like Plum. When you create your own business plan, make sure that the pictures and design you use make sense for your branding.</p> \n<p>Additionally, the financial charts included are incredibly helpful if you're not sure what financial information to include.</p> \n<h3>11. <a href=\"https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByPuznSKHuX_THJ5YmtDWjgxNDg/view\">LiveShopBuy Sample Business Plan</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/live-shop-buy-sample-business-plan.jpg?width=345&amp;name=live-shop-buy-sample-business-plan.jpg\" alt=\"LiveShopBuy business plan.\" width=\"345\" style=\"width: 345px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>With this business plan, the focus is the investment opportunity. This is an excellent template to use if you're going to use your business plan as a means to receive funding. The investment opportunity section is placed right up front and is several pages long. Then, the plan goes into more detail about the company synopsis industry analysis.</p> \n<p>When you're first getting starting on your business plan, it can be daunting. That's why it's important to make sure you understand the format and information you'll want to include. Then, you can use a template to guide your process.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in November 2018 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fsample-business-plans&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 07 Aug 2020 19:04:00 +0000","feedId":924,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/business-plan-1.jpg#keepProtocol","linkMd5":"c2bb87f43d1336961d48f1c060874da9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn44@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-28-272_d30a779cb9b9ac36.webp","metaImg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/business-plan-1.jpg#keepProtocol","author":"cchi@hubspot.com (Clifford Chi)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/One-Page%20Business%20Plan%20Template.jpg?width=1500&name=One-Page%20Business%20Plan%20Template.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn99@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-31-942_316daa92eb250477.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-08-07%20at%204.02.33%20PM.png?width=1500&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-08-07%20at%204.02.33%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn43@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-29-478_f6d635f92e47261a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/thoughtco-sample-business-plan.jpg?width=393&name=thoughtco-sample-business-plan.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn7@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-34-376_51fd7ded8b60314a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/bp-plans-business-template.jpg?width=364&name=bp-plans-business-template.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn63@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-31-408_9babe8b954f3fb19.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/panda-doc-sample-business-plan.jpg?width=449&name=panda-doc-sample-business-plan.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn23@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-35-382_0baf09bda7ca0d19.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/small-business-administration-sample-business-plan.jpg?width=600&name=small-business-administration-sample-business-plan.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn80@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-29-815_576c6683d95c8c26.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/culina-business-plan-template.jpg?width=381&name=culina-business-plan-template.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn87@2020_5/2020/08/16/13-48-36-858_e3c40c2fa898691e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/plum-sample-business-plan.jpg?width=369&name=plum-sample-business-plan.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn15@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-28-575_d9d704974bc8556b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/live-shop-buy-sample-business-plan.jpg?width=345&name=live-shop-buy-sample-business-plan.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn11@2020_3/2020/08/16/13-48-29-889_9bbdf24d36d593ed.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fsample-business-plans&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn47@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-28-571_c6f59bdfcd9e8624.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:25","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:25","title":"The 11 Facebook Ad Campaign Objectives and How to Choose What’s Right For Your Business","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-campaign-objectives","description":"<p>Facebook ads are a great tool to get your message in front of the platform’s <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/marketing/facebook\">2.5 billion monthly users</a>. With such a large audience, you can understand why the platform is attractive to advertisers. Over <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/marketing/facebook\">7 million</a> advertisers to be exact.</p> \n<p>To succeed and maximize your return on investment (ROI) among so many audience members and competitors, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/customers/3-takeaways-from-start-with-why?_ga=2.35710624.1083519983.1595599444-826779246.1592840265\" style=\"font-size: 1.125rem;\">start with why</a> you want to use Facebook ads and what you hope to achieve with them. After all, your campaign objective is the first thing Facebook will ask you about when you go to create an ad.</p> \n<p><span style=\"font-size: 1.125rem; font-weight: 400;\">Your <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/1438417719786914?id=802745156580214\">Facebook campaign objective</a> — meaning the action you want someone to take after they see your ad — is one way the platform determines who should be shown your ad.</span></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Within <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/tools/ads-manager\">Facebook Ads Manager</a>, there are 11 objectives spanning the <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/1438417719786914?id=802745156580214\">three overarching categories</a> of the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/what-is-the-buyers-journey?_ga=2.35710624.1083519983.1595599444-826779246.1592840265\">buyer’s journey</a>: awareness, consideration, and conversions.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20TK%20Facebook%20Ad%20Campaign%20Objectives%20and%20How%20to%20Choose.png?width=1500&amp;name=The%20TK%20Facebook%20Ad%20Campaign%20Objectives%20and%20How%20to%20Choose.png\" alt=\"facebook ad objective\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/adsmanager\">Source</a></em></p> \n<p>With so many options, the thought of determining which objective is best for you may feel a bit overwhelming, but no sweat — we’ll break them down below.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/facebook-advertising-training\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><em>Check out HubSpot's free course on Facebook Ads Training: How to Build Great Ads &amp; Audiences</em></span></a></p> \n<h2>Awareness Facebook Campaign Objectives</h2> \n<p>Awareness objectives help generate interest in your product or service.</p> \n<h3>1. Brand Awareness</h3> \n<p>As you may have guessed, these ads help <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/brand-awareness?_ga=2.203484816.1083519983.1595599444-826779246.1592840265\">increase people’s awareness of your business</a>. If you’re looking to introduce your brand to new audiences, this can be a great option. That's because Facebook will show these ads to members of your target audience who are more likely to pay attention to and recall the ads.</p> \n<p>Facebook <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/1029827880390718?id=429023050853196\">predicts recall ability</a> by polling users on whether they remember seeing an ad and analyzing their past behavior and interactions with ads.</p> \n<p>Keep in mind the sole focus of these ads is to make people aware of your brand, so you shouldn’t expect significant engagement or click-throughs. However, they <em>will</em> help you establish brand familiarity and pique the interest of your target audience.</p> \n<p>Use these ads to keep consumers aware of, and able to recall, your brand as well as highlight what makes your business and product/service unique.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose this ad to increase the chances of your target audience recognizing and recalling your brand, and the features that make it stand out from competitors.</p> \n<h3>2. Reach</h3> \n<p>Facebook reach ads are shown to as many people in your target audience as possible while staying within your budget constraints. You can even specify the specific location you would like your audience to be in, so the ad only reaches people near your business. An added bonus is the ability to choose the frequency of these ads, meaning how many times someone will see the ad.</p> \n<p>On one hand, this strategy maximizes the number of people who see your ad. On the other, Facebook doesn’t take into consideration the likelihood of the user paying attention to the ad. Meaning, you may end up paying for your ad to be displayed to audience members who tend to scroll past any form of advertisement on the platform.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose this ad to send your business message to as many of your target audience members as possible, even if it means attempting to reach those who typically ignore ads. This objective can work well for local businesses.</p> \n<h2>Consideration Facebook Campaign Objectives</h2> \n<p>Consideration objectives encourage audiences to think and learn more about your business.</p> \n<h3>3. Traffic</h3> \n<p>The traffic objective aims to send people from Facebook to any URL of your choosing, such as your website’s homepage, online storefront, app, event page, etc.</p> \n<p>Facebook does this by showing your ads to users who are likely to click based on their past behavior on the platform (newsflash: <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/full_data_use_policy\">Facebook knows a lot about its users</a>). By bringing more visitors to your featured destination, you’ll increase the likelihood of a user taking favorable actions on your landing page.</p> \n<p>Note that, with the traffic objective, Facebook is only responsible for collecting clicks and does not measure any action(s) — or lack thereof — a user takes once they leave the platform.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose this ad to direct viewers to a new URL destination so they can learn more about what you’re offering or promoting.</p> \n<h3>4. Engagement</h3> \n<p>Also based on past behavior, the platform shows engagement ads to those who they predict will engage with your ads in the form of likes, reactions, comments, and shares. The are 3 types of engagement ads: <strong>post engagement, page likes, and event responses</strong>.</p> \n<p>Post engagement and page likes will boost engagement for your ad and Facebook business page respectively. Event response engagement ads are a unique way to promote your event to increase attendance and get people excited.</p> \n<p>Engagement ads use social proof to determine where users are more likely to pay attention to, and be interested in, an ad after seeing how others interact with it.</p> \n<p>Take yourself for example — would you spend more time considering an ad with 473 likes or an ad with 14 likes? I’ll take the former, please.</p> \n<p>When others engage with your ads, their activity will also be shared with their Facebook friends, reaching even more people. Their validation will help your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/agency/how-online-word-of-mouth-marketing-is-changing?_ga=2.216279574.1083519983.1595599444-826779246.1592840265\">online word-of-mouth marketing</a>.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose this ad to establish brand credibility through likes, comments, and shares and increase interaction with your business on Facebook.</p> \n<h3>5. App Installs</h3> \n<p>This objective helps drive mobile app installs by taking users directly to the App Store or Google Play store to download your app. Facebook shows these ads to members of your target audience who have previously downloaded apps from ads to increase chances of your app installations.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose app installs ads to increase app downloads for your business.</p> \n<h3>6. Video Views</h3> \n<p>Facebook will push video views ads to your target audience with the objective of getting as many views as possible. These ads can be a powerful way to tell your brand story or show your service in an engaging and consumable. After all, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-trends-global-preferences?_ga=2.216279574.1083519983.1595599444-826779246.1592840265\">a HubSpot report</a> found that over 50% of consumers want to see video content from brands.</p> \n<p>What’s really valuable about video view ads is their ability to help you retarget those who watched your video. You can retarget people who watched your video content to remind them of your brand and product/service in hopes of boosting brand awareness and conversions.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose this ad to use video to share information about your business and reach your audience via an engaging medium. Then, retarget your viewers to boost chances of conversion.</p> \n<h3>7. Lead Generation</h3> \n<p>Lead generation ads are a great way to embed <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/creating-lead-generation-offers-from-blogs?_ga=2.13713847.1083519983.1595599444-826779246.1592840265\">lead magnets</a> and collect leads while allowing the user to stay on Facebook. Users submit their personal information in exchange for an offer created by your business, such as an email newsletter or workbook.</p> \n<p>The ability for the user to remain on Facebook is a huge advantage for this type of ad. This makes it easy for the user to fill in the ad’s form, while never leaving the page or straying too far from what it is they originally went to the platform for — this results in a seamless UX and can increase chances of conversion.</p> \n<p>Facebook can even auto-fill these forms by pulling contact information from the user’s account details so all they have to do is click \"Submit”.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose this ad to collect leads for your business with an enticing offer. This works best when the user is already in the consideration stage of their buyer’s journey and is therefore willing to exchange their information for something of value in return.</p> \n<h3>8. Messages</h3> \n<p>With the messages objective, viewers can directly message your business through the ad using <a href=\"https://www.messenger.com/\">Facebook Messenger</a>.</p> \n<p>This is an effective way to personally connect with users to generate more interest in your business. <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/tips-for-connecting-with-your-prospects-on-facebook?_ga=2.13713847.1083519983.1595599444-826779246.1592840265\">Engaging with your audience through Messenger</a> allows you to connect with your audience versus talking <em>at </em>them.</p> \n<p>Leverage your conversations as an opportunity to answer any questions, offer customer support, build rapport with your audience, collect leads, and drive sales. Messenger is a great way to show your customers that there’s a human on the other end, ready to help them.</p> \n<p>With these ads, it’s crucial that you’re ready to respond quickly and effectively once the messages flow in. Otherwise, prospective customers may lose interest if you’re not responsive to their inquiries.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose this ad to encourage users to contact your business through Facebook Messenger, if you’re prepared to respond in a timely manner.</p> \n<h2>Conversion Facebook Campaign Objectives</h2> \n<p>Conversion objectives nudge audiences to buy or use your product or service.</p> \n<h3>9. Conversions</h3> \n<p>The goal of conversion ads is to encourage people to take valuable actions on your website or app, such as registering for an event, adding an item to cart, or making a purchase.</p> \n<p>These ads are most successful when delivered to people who are already familiar with your product — likely, those who have gone through the awareness and consideration stages and need an extra push toward conversion.</p> \n<p>Installing the <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/learn/facebook-ads-pixel\">Facebook pixel</a> on your website will be required for these ads to help Facebook optimize your campaigns. The pixel is a piece of code for your site that tracks each time a user takes action and converts through a Facebook ad. With each conversion, Facebook learns who to target in the ads to maximize conversions.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose this ad to increase conversion actions on your site or app. These ads should be served to those who are already knowledgeable about your business.</p> \n<h3>10. Catalog Sales</h3> \n<p>The catalog sales ad is made with a holistic view of ecommerce stores in mind. Instead of promoting a single product or service, ads with this objective will show relevant products from your store to people who have demonstrated interest in them before. Facebook is able to recognize this behavior based on its understanding of your offerings and the user through its pixel.</p> \n<p>These ads require you to integrate your product catalog with Facebook so the platform can pull a selection from your store and adjust it as needed for audience members based on various factors, such as your latest arrivals.</p> \n<p>Catalog sales ads are also more specific than conversion ads because the end goal is to generate sales, whereas the goal of conversions ads can vary from increasing registration or adding payment information.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose this ad if you prefer Facebook select which products from your catalog are most relevant for your audience, based on their <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/customers/top-tips-to-machine-learning\">machine learning</a> predictions, in order to increase sales.</p> \n<h3>11. Store Traffic</h3> \n<p>The store traffic objective is perfect for businesses with physical locations as the goal is to remove the digital barrier and bring in-person foot traffic to your store.</p> \n<p>The ads are delivered to people who are physically near your store, so they are more likely to visit. It’s important to mention these ads target based on location only, which means audience demographics will not be considered.</p> \n<p>There are two necessities for store traffic ads to work. As the advertiser, you must ensure that all your business locations are properly entered in <a href=\"https://business.facebook.com/\">Business Manager</a>. For the consumer, their location services must be enabled so Facebook knows when to show the ad.</p> \n<p>With those stars aligned, you’ll be able to track your store visits at each location from the ad.</p> \n<p>TLDR: Choose this ad if your business has brick and mortar locations and you’re looking to increase store visits.</p> \n<p>Now, when you log into <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/tools/ads-manager\">Facebook Ads Manager</a>, you should have a better idea what all the campaign objectives mean. If you’re ready to roll your sleeves up, we can help you <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/facebook-paid-ad-checklist?_ga=2.210823829.1083519983.1595599444-826779246.1592840265\">step-by-step through the Facebook ad creation process.</a></p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Ffacebook-campaign-objectives&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; But landing pages don't convert visitors to leads all by themselves -- without attractive and compelling offers behind them, they won't generate the tons of leads for your sales team that you want them to.</p>  \n<p>That's why it's so important to create valuable content people want to download, and then package it in a way that's visually appealing to your readers.&nbsp;A big part of the ebook creation process is making it look both&nbsp;professional and attractive&nbsp;so people want to read it and share it.</p> \n<h3></h3> \n<p>We know not every team&nbsp;has someone in-house who can (or has time to) whip up a slick, highly shareable ebook design. But we have&nbsp;good news: You don't need to be a designer by trade to design beautiful ebooks yourself. With the right resources and approach,&nbsp;it doesn't have to be a&nbsp;daunting task.</p> \n<p>We created <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/ebook-templates?_ga=2.146592881.413518659.1563195890-1307414301.1541080541\">ebook templates</a> to help make this process easier for you -- and they were so popular that <strong>we decided to revamp the offer for 18 new-and-improved ebook templates for you.</strong>&nbsp;We hope these templates&nbsp;minimize the&nbsp;time you spend&nbsp;on the details of design, allowing you to concentrate on writing valuable, lead-generating content your readers will love.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/ebook-templates?_ga=2.229139292.1301801515.1563199473-1093622293.1516842654\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Untitled%20design%20(20)-1.png?width=1000&amp;name=Untitled%20design%20(20)-1.png\" width=\"1000\" style=\"width: 1000px;\" alt=\"Free ebook templates by HubSpot\"></a></p> \n<h5 style=\"text-align: center; text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/ebook-templates?_ga=2.183779171.413518659.1563195890-1307414301.1541080541\">Download the Templates Now</a></h5> \n<h2>Start With One of These Free Ebook Templates</h2> \n<p>Here is a preview of some of the ebooks you'll find in the template bundle:</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/ebook-templates\">Artistic Theme</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/artistic-theme.jpg?width=400&amp;name=artistic-theme.jpg\" alt=\"example page from the artistic theme that reads &quot;creative ebook template with an artistic theme&quot; in purple along with a dynamic photo of a laptop with purple screen\" width=\"400\" style=\"width: 400px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>This template uses white space so that you can have your colorful headers, eye-catching graphics, and stunning images do all the talking. It includes several layout options so that the design is kept fresh from one page to another.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/ebook-templates\">Professional Theme</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/professional-theme.jpg?width=400&amp;name=professional-theme.jpg\" alt=\"example page from the professional theme that reads &quot;creative ebook template with a professional theme&quot; along with a photo in the center and banded blue background\" width=\"400\" style=\"width: 400px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>Create a professional but bold feel with image-based title pages and thick, bold fonts. This template also includes photo-heavy pages, making it perfect for a showcase or inspiration guide.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/ebook-templates\">Honeycomb Theme</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/honeycomb-theme.jpg?width=400&amp;name=honeycomb-theme.jpg\" alt=\"example page from the honeycomb theme that reads &quot;An Intro To This Topic of Your Choosing&quot; in yellow against a blue background where the bottom half is repeated honeycomb shapes\" width=\"400\" style=\"width: 400px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>Speaking of geometrical shapes, this one uses hexagonal shapes in the background and for emphasis, providing a striking honeycomb theme. In addition, you'll also find page layouts for quotes and captioned photos, making it a good choice for ebooks with a variety of types of content.</p> \n<h3>With these slick new templates, you’ll be able to:</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Create beautifully&nbsp;designed ebooks</strong> without either the cost of a designer or experience with InDesign/Illustrator/Photoshop.</li> \n <li><strong>Choose from six different ebook designs across three different platforms (Adobe InDesign, PowerPoint, and Google Slides),</strong> and even add your own brand colors to any of&nbsp;them in a few quick steps.</li> \n <li><strong>Spend more&nbsp;time writing awesome content</strong> and&nbsp;less time getting the layout right.</li> \n <li><strong>Use all of the stock images provided</strong> in +0000","feedId":924,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-2074430753-gif/ebook-template-lp-image-2.gif#keepProtocol","linkMd5":"8e72a2fdff2910ad0a9d1b78559b49ea","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx20/cdn23@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-29-122_cfa85c0fc672c4d8.webp","metaImg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-2074430753-gif/ebook-template-lp-image-2.gif#keepProtocol","destWidth":720,"destHeight":405,"author":"rohiggins@hubspot.com (Rachael O'Higgins)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Untitled%20design%20(20)-1.png?width=1000&name=Untitled%20design%20(20)-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn71@2020_4/2020/08/16/13-48-28-878_2b510bef68326e19.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/artistic-theme.jpg?width=400&name=artistic-theme.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn43@2020_6/2020/08/16/13-48-31-308_106ee0b5ca9ce267.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/professional-theme.jpg?width=400&name=professional-theme.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn88@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-32-620_50b38fed2dc50a8a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/honeycomb-theme.jpg?width=400&name=honeycomb-theme.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx17/cdn52@2020_2/2020/08/16/13-48-39-998_3759583ac9f7ddb8.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Ffree-ebook-templates&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn96@2020_1/2020/08/16/13-48-35-286_6d0b03d698b19e03.webp"}},{"createdTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:26","updatedTime":"2020-08-16 21:48:26","title":"How Using Humans And Chatbots Together Generated 182% More Qualified Leads","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-chatbot-generated-more-qualified-leads","description":"<p><em>This post is a part of Made @ HubSpot, an internal thought leadership series through which we extract lessons from experiments conducted by our very own HubSpotters.</em></p> \n<p>Prospect expectations for businesses have never been higher — in fact, <a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/data/personalized-brand-experience-statistics/\">according to Google</a>, 61% of people now expect brands to deliver personalized experiences.&nbsp;</p>  \n<p>At the same time, the amount of people who want to reach a business through <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/news/insights/why-messaging-businesses-is-the-new-normal\">messaging continues to rise</a>. Which means keeping up on chat can be tough, even for well-trained teams.</p> \n<p>At HubSpot, we felt the brunt of that pain in early 2018. We have a specific sales team that handles chatting with people on our website. At the time, we'd been using live chat across most of HubSpot.com to engage with prospects in a way that felt natural.</p> \n<p>Unfortunately, sales leadership began noticing we were losing out on valuable, high-intent prospects who were attempting to reach us via live chat. We simply didn't have a guaranteed way of ensuring their needs were addressed by a member of our team — which meant we were losing out on potential sales, big time.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>When my marketing team at HubSpot connected with the sales team to discuss the issue, we recognized live chat alone no longer suited our needs. To appropriately communicate with each prospect and create that highly personalized experience our website visitors crave, we needed to scale our sales team's productivity with a chatbot.</p> \n<p>Here, we'll explore why we decided to build a chatbot, how we designed the experience, and why it might be an outstanding solution for your own business in 2019 — and beyond.</p> \n<h2>Why Live Chat Didn't Work For Us</h2> \n<p>When the live chat sales team reached out to us, we knew we needed to make the team more efficient.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm/live-chat\">Live chat</a> in-and-of-itself wasn't a problem — but, unfortunately, we weren't tailoring the conversations to the visitor and their problems. We knew sifting through each and every visitor's inquiry was the right thing to do, since it helped <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/customer-code?&amp;_ga=2.174408802.1948013277.1554735922-509227949.1547064439\">solve for the customer</a> and answer any prospect's questions.</p> \n<p>But, since they all fell under the same bucket, it became increasingly difficult for the sales team to keep up. And for the majority of people who didn't leave us with a way to get back in touch, they were gone forever.</p> \n<blockquote>\n At one point, over a third of the people who chatted with us \n <em>never</em> heard anything back.\n</blockquote> \n<p>Additionally, hundreds of the chats we received each month were from users who simply needed product support. This ate part of our sales team's valuable bandwidth, making it harder for them to get in touch with site visitors who actually needed to speak with a sales rep.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, this poor experience added unnecessary friction for our site visitors and sales reps.</p> \n<h2>Why We Decided to Build a Chatbot</h2> \n<p>After some internal discussion, we set out to build a chatbot that would engage with visitors, triage them, and get them to the right place, sooner. This would be a win-win for both visitors to our site, and the sales team.</p> \n<p>To figure out what this chatbot should do, we first looked at live chat transcripts. They're an invaluable resource when doing conversational marketing, since you can hear in the prospect's own words what they want to do. There are technical ways to classify chats (like natural language processing), but a qualitative approach is fine to start.</p> \n<p>We then bucketed intents from live chat into three buckets — sales, support, and a catch-all \"other\". To start the chatbot, we prompted people to select the topic that best matched their intent.</p> \n<p>After speaking with our support team, we learned that getting technical help with a product while on the website can be tricky. There are rich and thorough resources better-suited for getting these kinds of answers. So, rather than keeping someone in the chatbot, we used what we know about them in the CRM to point them in the right direction. The chatbot would look at their contact record, and then serve up a contextual web page depending on the products they were using.</p> \n<p>Even though our prospects couldn't connect with a human right away, we set them up for better long-term success.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/How%20Using%20Humans%20And%20Chatbots%20Together%20Generated%20182%25%20More%20Qualified%20Leads.png?width=1500&amp;name=How%20Using%20Humans%20And%20Chatbots%20Together%20Generated%20182%25%20More%20Qualified%20Leads.png\" alt=\"hubspot chatbot example\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>Next, we recognized a large percentage of the people who interacted with live chat did, in fact, want to talk to our sales team. But that didn't mean trying to connect them to a human right away was efficient for either group.</p> \n<p>We interviewed and observed the sales team to understand their experience with chat. Right away, we noticed each sales rep needed to know three key facts about the user to tailor the conversation to their business — name, email, and website.</p> \n<p>The sales team said in an ideal world, they wanted this context before chatting with a prospect — an issue we knew a chatbot could solve. We programmed the chatbot to collect this information in a natural, contextual way.</p> \n<p>Additionally, we knew a prospect would become frustrated if they needed to repeat themselves — in fact, <a href=\"https://www.newvoicemedia.com/en-us/resources/serial-switchers-strikes-again-us\">NewVoiceMedia</a> found it to be the <em>most </em>frustrating aspect of customer experience. To combat this issue, we again checked the CRM, and if you'd ever filled out a HubSpot form, we'd skip the questions altogether.</p> \n<p>Collecting this information up-front enabled the sales team to spend more time selling, and less time chasing down email addresses.</p> \n<h2>Our Results</h2> \n<p>At the beginning of this project, our main goal was to deflect support-related chats away from our sales team. But, even as someone who has been building chatbots for almost four years, I'll admit — what we saw was shocking.</p> \n<p>When compared to <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm/live-chat\">live chat</a>, <strong>75% more people engaged with the chatbot.</strong></p> \n<p>Additionally, over 55% of people gave real answers to the basic qualifying questions and reached a human. While the drop-off there may seem steep, sifting out low-intent people proved incredibly helpful for the sales team.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/chatbot-hubspot-2.png?width=1500&amp;name=chatbot-hubspot-2.png\" alt=\"hubspot chatbot results\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>Ultimately, our chatbot's success came in a few ways — first, the chatbot anticipated the next step of the conversation and used quick replies to drive a visitor forward. Opening up a chat and clicking a contextual button has less friction than typing in a text field — now, people didn't need to come up with the first message themselves.</p> \n<p>It makes sense that multiple choice options drive more engagement. Think of it this way — when you meet someone new, often the hardest part of the conversation is the beginning, when you're trying to think of something to say. But once the conversation starts rolling, things become smoother.</p> \n<p>The same is true for our prospects when they engage with a chatbot versus live chat.</p> \n<p>Additionally, 9% of people who chatted with the bot needed support help — we were able to deflect those visitors away from humans in a helpful way, serving up the best place to get answers to their questions quickly.</p> \n<p>It's important to note when designing conversations, the hardest and most overlooked aspect is to write like a human. As consumers, we rarely process in our heads that we want to \"talk to sales\". Instead, we only know we want to talk about \"products I'm not yet using\". Writing with the \"<a href=\"https://hbr.org/2016/09/know-your-customers-jobs-to-be-done\">jobs to be done</a>\" in mind is a great philosophy for conversational design.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/How%20Using%20Humans%20And%20Chatbots%20Together%20Generated%20182%25%20More%20Qualified%20Leads-1.png?width=1500&amp;name=How%20Using%20Humans%20And%20Chatbots%20Together%20Generated%20182%25%20More%20Qualified%20Leads-1.png\" alt=\"how chatbot generated more qualified leads hubspot\" width=\"1500\" style=\"width: 1500px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<h2>Takeaways for Your Business</h2> \n<p>At the end of the experiment, I've found a few takeaways that can help you and your business succeed, as well.</p> \n<p>First, chatbots are a great opportunity to meet your visitors where they are. If you want to get started with a chatbot, look at chat transcripts, or interview your sales team to understand the types of questions people typically ask. Bucket those questions into a few critical categories.</p> \n<p>Also, it's critical you and your team think through and anticipate the best way to help those various buckets of people. The more you can personalize — perhaps through your CRM — the better.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, using a chatbot to get people the help they need is a huge win for both your prospects and your business. In our case, site visitors now had the best resources for their support issues, and our sales team was able to capture more qualified leads.</p> \n<p>The best part? Both sides did this in a frictionless, efficient way.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally written in February 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p>
